subsection.content: Despite any other provisions of this Part but subject to subsection (6), if the Commission proposes to make rules under subsection (1), it must publish a draft of the proposed rules, in a manner that it considers appropriate, for the purpose of inviting representations on the proposed rules by the public.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission makes any rules under subsection (1) after a draft is published under subsection (4) in relation to the rules, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: publish, in a manner that it considers appropriate, an account setting out in general terms—

subparagraph.content: the representations made on the draft; and
the response of the Commission to the representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the rules are made with modifications that in the opinion of the Commission result in the rules being significantly different from the draft, publish, in a manner that it considers appropriate, details of the difference.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (4) and (5) do not apply if the Commission considers, in the circumstances of the case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is inappropriate or unnecessary that those subsections should apply; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any delay involved in complying with those subsections—

subparagraph.content: would not be in the interest of the investing public; or
would not be in the public interest.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subsections (4), (5) and (6) do not affect any other requirements that, apart from those subsections, apply to the making of any rules under any provision of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If rules are made by the Commission under subsection (1), the Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to provide that a person who contravenes any specified provision of the rules that applies to the person commits an offence and is liable to a specified penalty not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment a fine of $500,000 and imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53ZTM
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules 3B to 3F

subsection.content: The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3B.
The Commission may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3C.
The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 3D, 3E and 3F.

section.name: s53ZTN
section.heading: Commission may waive or refund fees
section.leadIn: The Commission may, in relation to any person or class of persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive, in whole or in part, the payment of any fee under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refund, in whole or in part, any fee paid under this Part,

section.continued: if the Commission is of the opinion that otherwise the payment of the fee would be unduly burdensome or inappropriate.

section.name: s53ZTO
section.heading: Offence for making false or misleading representation in connection with application

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in connection with an application made to the Commission under this Part, whether for the person or for another person, makes a representation, whether in writing, orally or otherwise, that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the representation is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with an application made to the Commission under this Part, whether for the person or for another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a representation with the result that the representation is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the material particular is omitted from the representation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Representation
def.leadIn: representation (表述) means a representation or statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a matter of fact, either present or past;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: about a future event; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: about an existing intention, opinion, belief, knowledge or other state of mind.

section.name: s53ZTP
section.heading: Offence for providing false or misleading information, if information required under this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement to provide information imposed by or under any provision of this Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: provides to the Commission any information that is false or misleading in a material particular; or
omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the provision of information that is false or misleading in a material particular if the provision of the information in purported compliance with a requirement imposed by or under any provision of this Ordinance would, apart from subsection (1), also constitute an offence under any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s53ZTQ
section.heading: Offence for providing false or misleading document, if document required in connection with Commission’s function

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: otherwise than in purported compliance with a requirement to provide information imposed by or under any provision of this Ordinance but, in connection with the performance by the Commission of a function under this Ordinance, provides to the Commission any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document is false or misleading in a material particular; and

has, in relation to the provision of the record or document, received prior written warning from the Commission to the effect that the provision of any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular or omission of a material particular from a statement in the circumstances of the case would constitute an offence under this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be convicted of an offence under subsection (1) only if the prosecution proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonably relied on the record or document in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person intended that the Commission would rely on the record or document in question.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (2)(a) does not require it to be proved that the Commission who has reasonably relied on any record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was misled;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suffered any detriment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: incurred any loss,

subsection.continued: as a result of the reliance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53ZTR
section.heading: Certain representations prohibited

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a licensed provider or a licensed representative—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not represent that the abilities or qualifications of the licensed provider or the licensed representative (as the case requires) have been endorsed or warranted by the Government or the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not permit any other person to make representations to the effect referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: A statement to the effect that a person is licensed under this Ordinance does not by itself constitute a contravention of subsection (1).

If a licensed provider or a licensed representative, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), the licensed provider or the licensed representative commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: represent (表述) includes represent in any way, whether expressly or by implication.

section.name: s53ZTS
section.heading: Offence for obstructing person in performance of functions

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, obstructs any specified person in the performance of a function under or in carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member, employee, or consultant, agent or adviser, of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person appointed to investigate any matter under this Ordinance.

section.name: s53ZTT
section.heading: Time limitation for prosecution
section.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings may be instituted for an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Part within 3 years after the commission of the offence.

section.name: s53ZTU
section.heading: Power of Commission to intervene in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are any judicial or other proceedings (other than criminal proceedings) that concern a matter provided for in any of the provisions in this Ordinance, or in which the Commission has an interest by virtue of its functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission is satisfied that it is in the public interest for the Commission to intervene and be heard in the proceedings,

subsection.continued: the Commission, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, may, by an application made in accordance with subsection (2) to the court hearing or otherwise having competent authority to hear the proceedings, apply to intervene and be heard in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: An application made for the purposes of subsection (1) must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supported by an affidavit showing that the conditions set out in subsection (1)(a) and (b) are satisfied.

subsection.content: A copy of the application made for the purposes of subsection (1) must be served on each of the parties to the proceedings to which the application relates as soon as reasonably practicable after the application is made.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the court to which an application is made for the purposes of subsection (1) may by order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application, subject to any terms that it considers just; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: The court to which an application is made for the purposes of subsection (1) must not make an order pursuant to subsection (4)(a) or (b) without first giving the following persons a reasonable opportunity of being heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of the parties to the proceedings to which the application relates.

subsection.leadIn: If an application made for the purposes of subsection (1) is allowed under subsection (4)(a), the Commission, subject to the terms referred to in subsection (4)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may intervene and be heard in the proceedings to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be regarded for all purposes as a party to the proceedings and has the rights, duties and liabilities of such a party.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section affects Order 15, rule 6 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法庭) includes a magistrate and a tribunal, other than the Review Tribunal.

section.name: s53ZTV
section.heading: Civil proceedings by Commission
section.content: The Commission may begin or carry on any civil proceedings by a solicitor or otherwise.

section.name: s53ZTW
section.heading: Conflict of interest

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the Commission or any person performing any function under this Ordinance (the member or person called in this section a specified person) must not directly or indirectly effect or cause to be effected, on the specified person’s own account or for the benefit of any other person, a transaction regarding any virtual assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which transaction the specified person knows is, or is connected with a transaction or a person that is, the subject of any investigation or proceedings by the Commission under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which transaction the specified person knows is otherwise being considered by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any transaction that a holder of virtual assets effects or causes to be effected by reference to any of their rights as such holder—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to charge or pledge the virtual assets to secure the repayment of money;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to realize the virtual assets for the purpose of repaying money secured under paragraph (b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to realize the virtual assets in the course of performing a duty imposed by law.

subsection.leadIn: A specified person must inform the Commission if, in the course of performing any function under this Part, the specified person is required to consider any matter relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any virtual assets—

subparagraph.content: in which the specified person has an interest;
in which a corporation, in the shares of which the specified person has an interest, has an interest; or
that are of or issued by the same issuer as those in which the specified person has an interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.content: by whom the specified person is or was employed;
of whom the specified person is or was a client;
who is or was the specified person’s associate; or

subparagraph.leadIn: whom the specified person knows is or was a client of a person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: with whom the specified person is or was employed; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who is or was the specified person’s associate.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the spouse, or any minor child (natural or adopted) or minor step-child, of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation of which the person is a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any employee or partner of the person;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: another person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the person is accustomed or obliged to act;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: another person accustomed or obliged to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the person;

paragraph.name: g
h
j
paragraph.content: a corporation of which the person controls the composition of the board of directors;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a corporation—

subparagraph.content: any of its directors or any of its related corporations or any director or employee of any of its related corporations; and
a pension fund, provident fund or employee share scheme of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the circumstances in which paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) and (k) apply, in circumstances concerning the securities of or other interest in a corporation, or rights arising out of the holding of such securities or such interest, any other person with whom the person has an agreement or arrangement—

subparagraph.content: with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of such securities or such interest; or
under which they undertake to act together in exercising their voting power at general meetings of the corporation.

section.name: s53ZTX
section.heading: Evidence regarding Commission’s records or documents

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to a record or document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be signed, executed or issued by or on behalf of the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be signed or initialled by any member of the Commission or any person performing any function under any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The record or document is admissible in any proceedings as evidence of the facts stated in it, without proof of the signature or initials of the person purporting to sign or initial the record or document.

section.name: s53ZTY
section.heading: Transitional provisions
section.content: The transitional provisions specified in Schedule 3G have effect.

part.name: P5C
part.heading: Regulation of Dealings in Precious Metals and Stones

section.name: s53ZTZ
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5C
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Branch
def.leadIn: branch (分行), subject to section 53ZVP, means any premises that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are used by a registrant for the purpose of the carrying out of face-to-face transactions with customers; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not the principal place of business of the registrant;

section.def: branch certificate (分行證明書) means a certificate issued under section 53ZUG(1)(c) or 53ZUP(1)(c) in respect of a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant and includes any certificate issued under section 53ZVA for replacing such a certificate;

def.name: BusinessPremises
def.leadIn: business premises (業務處所), in relation to a person who is registered as a registrant or who applies to be registered as a registrant, means, subject to section 53ZVP, any premises at which the registrant carries on a precious metals and stones business, including any premises used by the registrant for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carrying out of face-to-face transactions with customers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the administration of the affairs or business of the registrant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the processing of transactions; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the storage of documents, data or records;

section.def: cash (現金) includes cash in any currency;

Category B registrant (B類註冊人) means a person whose name is entered in the register as such under section 53ZUP and whose registration has not been suspended under section 53ZUU and, except in sections 53ZUO, 53ZUP, 53ZUQ, 53ZUR, 53ZUS and 53ZUT, includes a person deemed under section 53ZW to be a Category B registrant;

certificate of registration (註冊證明書) means a certificate issued under section 53ZUG(1)(b) or 53ZUP(1)(b) in respect of a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant and includes any certificate issued under section 53ZVA for replacing such a certificate;

def.name: NonHongKongPreciousMetalsAndStonesDealer
def.leadIn: non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer (非香港貴金屬及寶石交易商) means any person who deals in precious metals and stones in Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is an individual who does not ordinarily reside in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is a legal person, other than an individual, that is incorporated or established outside Hong Kong and is neither a registered non-Hong Kong company nor a re-domiciled company; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 271)
does not have a place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: PreciousassetbackedInstruments
def.leadIn: precious-asset-backed instruments (貴重資產支持工具)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any certificate or instrument backed by one or more precious metals, precious stones or precious products that entitles the holder to such assets (in entirety or in part); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include—

subparagraph.content: a futures contract as defined by the Cap. 571 interpretation section;
any interest in a collective investment scheme as defined by the Cap. 571 interpretation section;
a structured product as defined by the Cap. 571 interpretation section;
an OTC derivative product as defined by the Cap. 571 interpretation section; or
a virtual asset;

section.def: precious metal (貴金屬) means gold, silver, platinum, iridium, osmium, palladium, rhodium or ruthenium, in a manufactured or unmanufactured state;
precious product (貴重產品) means any jewellery or watch made up of, containing or having attached to it, any precious metal or precious stone, or both;
precious stone (寶石) means diamond, sapphire, ruby, emerald, jade or pearl, whether natural or otherwise;
register (註冊紀錄冊), when used as a noun, means the register maintained under section 53ZUC;
registrant (註冊人) means a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant;

def.name: SpecifiedCashTransaction
def.leadIn: specified cash transaction (指明現金交易) means a transaction carried out by a person, while carrying on a precious metals and stones business, in respect of which transaction a payment or payments in cash, of at least the amount specified in Schedule 3H in total, is or are made or received in Hong Kong, whether the transaction is executed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a single operation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in several operations that are linked or appear to be linked;

def.name: SpecifiedTransaction
def.leadIn: specified transaction (指明交易) means a transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is a transaction carried out by a person, while carrying on a precious metals and stones business, in respect of which transaction a payment or payments, of at least the amount specified in Schedule 3I in total, is or are made or received in any way or combination of ways (other than in cash) in Hong Kong, whether the transaction is executed—

subparagraph.content: in a single operation; or
in several operations that are linked or appear to be linked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a specified cash transaction;

section.def: trading in (買賣), in relation to precious metals, precious stones, precious products or precious-asset-backed instruments, means selling, offering for sale, purchasing, offering to purchase or possessing for the purpose of sale;

def.name: UltimateOwner
def.leadIn: ultimate owner (最終擁有人)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an individual (first-mentioned individual) carrying on a precious metals and stones business—

subparagraph.content: means another individual who ultimately owns or controls the precious metals and stones business; or
if the first-mentioned individual is acting on behalf of another person, means that other person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a partnership, means an individual who—

subparagraph.content: is entitled, directly or indirectly, to more than a 25% share of the capital or profits of the partnership;
controls, directly or indirectly, more than a 25% share of the capital or profits of the partnership;
exercises ultimate control over the management of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a corporation, means an individual who—

subparagraph.content: is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 25% of the voting rights at general meetings of the corporation; or
exercises ultimate control over the management of the corporation.

section.name: s53ZU
section.heading: Meaning of dealing in precious metals and stones

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person deals in precious metals and stones if the person carries on any of the following activities by way of business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: trading in, importing or exporting precious metals, precious stones or precious products;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: manufacturing, refining or carrying out any value-adding work on precious metals, precious stones or precious products;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issuing, redeeming or trading in precious-asset-backed instruments;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: acting as an intermediary in respect of any of the activities in paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.content: However, a person who carries on a logistics service business does not deal in precious metals and stones only because the person imports or exports precious metals, precious stones or precious products in the ordinary course of that business.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: logistics service business (物流服務業務) means a business of transporting, or arranging for the transportation of, goods for other persons.

section.name: s53ZUA
section.heading: Disapplication of Part 5C

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a pawnbroker licensed under the Pawnbrokers Ordinance (Cap. 166);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation that carries on a precious metals and stones business that is ancillary to any regulated activity (as defined by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571)) carried out by the corporation for which the corporation is licensed under that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer that carries on a precious metals and stones business that is ancillary to the insurer’s principal business;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company that carries on a precious metals and stones business that is ancillary to the company’s principal business;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: an SVF licensee that carries on a precious metals and stones business that is ancillary to the SVF licensee’s principal business; or

a system operator or settlement institution of a designated retail payment system that carries on a precious metals and stones business that is ancillary to its business as a system operator or settlement institution.

subsection.content: Except for Divisions 1, 7, 8 and 9, this Part does not apply to a non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer.
The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may by regulation prescribe a class or description of persons to whom this Part does not apply.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Delegation of Functions and Register of Precious Metals and Stones Dealers

section.name: s53ZUB
section.heading: Delegation of functions

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner of Customs and Excise may in writing delegate any of his or her functions under this Ordinance to a public officer employed in the Customs and Excise Department.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner of Customs and Excise may not delegate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power to delegate under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power to amend Schedule 3J or 3K under section 53ZVQ; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the power to make regulations under section 53ZVS.

section.name: s53ZUC
section.heading: Commissioner to maintain register

subsection.content: The Commissioner must maintain a register of persons registered under this Part in a form the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to every Category A registrant or Category B registrant, the register must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the registrant is a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address of the registrant’s principal place of business; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the address of each branch of the registrant (if any).

subsection.content: The register must be made available for inspection by a member of the public to enable him or her to ascertain whether he or she is dealing with a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant.
A member of the public is entitled, without charge, to inspect the register during normal office hours.

Despite subsection (4), the Commissioner may, if satisfied that it is reasonable to do so in the circumstances, withhold the address of the principal place of business or a branch of a registrant (or part of the address) in the register from a person who inspects the register.

section.name: s53ZUD
section.heading: Certified copy of register

subsection.leadIn: A person may, on the payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3K, obtain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified copy or an uncertified copy of an entry in, or extract from, the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate by the Commissioner stating—

subparagraph.content: that the name of a person has not been entered in the register; or
that the name of a person has been removed from the register.

subsection.leadIn: In any criminal or civil proceedings, a copy of an entry in, or extract from, the register, purporting to be certified by the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is admissible in evidence on production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is evidence of the facts stated in it.

subsection.content: The fact that the name of a person does not appear on a copy of an entry in, or extract from, the register, purporting to be certified by the Commissioner is evidence that, at the date on which the copy is purporting to be certified, the person was not a registrant.

subsection.leadIn: In any criminal or civil proceedings, a certificate purporting to be signed by the Commissioner and stating any of the following is admissible in evidence on production without further proof and is to be conclusive evidence of the facts stated in the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the name of a person has not been entered in the register;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the name of a person has been removed from the register.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), the Commissioner may, if satisfied that it is reasonable to do so in the circumstances, withhold the address of the principal place of business or a branch of a registrant (or part of the address) in the register or part of the address from a person who requests for a copy of an entry in, or extract from, the register.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Restriction on Dealing in Precious Metals and Stones

section.name: s53ZUE
section.heading: Offence of carrying out certain transaction without registration

subsection.content: No person other than a registrant may carry out a specified transaction in Hong Kong.
No person other than a Category B registrant may carry out a specified cash transaction in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is not a registrant must not claim or hold out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is a registrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person is authorized to carry out a specified transaction in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is not a Category B registrant must not claim or hold out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is a Category B registrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person is authorized to carry out a specified cash transaction in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is convicted of an offence under this section, the magistrate may order that the person be disqualified from being registered as a registrant for a period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specified in the order.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Category A Registrant: Application for, Grant, Cancellation and Suspension of, Registration

section.name: s53ZUF
section.heading: Application for and grant of registration

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application, register a person as a Category A registrant for carrying on a precious metals and stones business that includes the carrying out of specified transactions but excludes the carrying out of specified cash transactions.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the grant of registration as a Category A registrant must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in the form and way specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3K.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2)(a), the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a copy of a valid business registration certificate of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by a declaration by the applicant that—

subparagraph.content: the precious metals and stones business which the applicant proposes to carry on will be carried on for a lawful purpose; or

if the applicant has been carrying on a precious metals and stones business immediately before 1 April 2023 and makes the application during the transitional period—the applicant’s precious metals and stones business is carried on, and will continue to be carried on, for a lawful purpose; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain the address of each premises that the applicant intends to be used as business premises and the applicant’s correspondence address.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may register a person as a Category A registrant only if the Commissioner is satisfied of the matters specified in subsections (5) and (6).

subsection.leadIn: The matter specified for the purposes of subsection (4) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the precious metals and stones business that the person proposes to carry on will be carried on for a lawful purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person has been carrying on a precious metals and stones business immediately before 1 April 2023 and makes the application during the transitional period—the person’s precious metals and stones business is carried on, and will continue to be carried on, for a lawful purpose.

subsection.content: The matter specified for the purposes of subsection (4) is that, in relation to an applicant who intends to use any domestic premises as business premises, the applicant has secured the written consent of every occupant of the premises for any authorized person, as defined by section 8, to enter the premises for the purpose of exercising the powers under section 9.
On registering a person as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner may impose any conditions that the Commissioner considers appropriate.
Section 53ZUJ applies to the determination of an application under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: transitional period (過渡期) has the meaning given by section 53ZW(8).

section.name: s53ZUG
section.heading: Certificate of registration and branch certificates

subsection.leadIn: On granting a person’s application for registration as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the person’s name in the register and specify that the person is a Category A registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a branch certificate for each branch of the registrant (if any).

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of registration issued in respect of a person registered as a Category A registrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state that the person is so registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be in a form specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must specify the address of the principal place of business of the registrant.

subsection.content: A branch certificate issued for a branch of a Category A registrant must be in a form specified by the Commissioner and must specify the address of the branch.

section.name: s53ZUH
section.heading: Annual fee
section.content: A Category A registrant must pay to the Commissioner an annual fee specified in Schedule 3K annually on or before each anniversary of the date on which the registrant’s registration takes effect.

section.name: s53ZUI
section.heading: Amendment of conditions of registration

subsection.leadIn: In relation to the registration of a person as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner may, at any time, if satisfied that it is reasonable to do so in the circumstances—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any new conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend any previously imposed conditions; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove any previously imposed conditions.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUJ applies to a decision made under subsection (1).

section.name: s53ZUJ
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to sections 53ZUF and 53ZUI

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2) and (3) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to the registration of a person as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner decides to impose a new condition or amend or remove a condition under section 53ZUI.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must inform the Category A registrant of the decision referred to in subsection (1) by written notice and the notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the registrant may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The imposition, amendment or removal of a condition referred to in subsection (1) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(a) applies—at the time the registration takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(b) applies—at the time the notice is given under subsection (2) or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is later.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner decides not to grant the registration of a person as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner must inform the person of the decision by written notice and the notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the person may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

section.name: s53ZUK
section.heading: Cessation of registration
section.leadIn: The registration of a person as a Category A registrant ceases to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registrant notifies the Commissioner that the registrant has the intention referred to in section 53ZVB(1)(a) or (b)—on the intended date of cessation (as defined by section 53ZVB(3)) as notified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Commissioner has approved an application by the registrant to be registered as a Category B registrant under section 53ZUO;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registrant is an individual—on the death of the individual;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the registrant is a partnership—on the dissolution of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the registrant is a corporation—on the commencement of winding up of the corporation.

section.name: s53ZUL
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of registration

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a person registered as a Category A registrant, the Commissioner may in any of the situations specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the person’s registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the person’s registration for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: The situations are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is convicted of an offence for contravening section 53ZUE(2) or (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person contravenes a regulation made under section 53ZVS;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person contravenes any of the conditions of the person’s registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person fails to pay the annual fee specified in Schedule 3K when it is due;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person fails to comply with an order made under section 53ZVE(3)(b) to take remedial action;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the person ceases to hold a valid business registration certificate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: there are circumstances suggesting that the person’s business has been, is being or will be carried on for an unlawful purpose; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the person uses any domestic premises as business premises for its precious metals and stones business, and—

subparagraph.content: any occupant of the premises revokes his or her written consent previously given for any authorized person, as defined by section 8, to enter the premises for the purpose of exercising the powers under section 9; or
any new occupant of the premises refuses to give such a written consent.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may exercise a power under subsection (1) in relation to a person only after giving the person a reasonable opportunity to be heard.

section.name: s53ZUM
section.heading: Supplementary provisions on cancellation or suspension of registration

subsection.leadIn: On deciding to cancel or suspend the registration of a person as a Category A registrant (affected person) under section 53ZUL, the Commissioner must inform the affected person of the decision by written notice and the notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include a statement of the reasons for the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a decision to suspend registration, specify the duration and terms of the suspension; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: include a statement that the affected person may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

subsection.content: Any fee paid for the grant of registration as a Category A registrant, or as an annual fee for the registration, is not refundable on the cancellation or suspension of the registration.

If the registration of the affected person is cancelled under section 53ZUL, the certificate of registration and each branch certificate (if any) in respect of the affected person cease to have effect from the day on which the cancellation takes effect as a specified decision under section 75.

subdivision.name: SD1

section.name: s53ZUN
section.heading: Fit and proper test

subsection.content: In a reference in this Ordinance to a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business or a fit and proper person to be associated with such a business, the business concerned is a precious metals and stones business that includes the carrying out of specified transactions and specified cash transactions.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of section 53ZUO, 53ZUQ, 53ZUU, 53ZUW, 53ZUX or 53ZUY, the Commissioner must, in addition to any other matter that the Commissioner considers relevant, have regard to the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the person has been convicted of—

subparagraph.content: an offence under section 25(1) or 25A(5) or (7) of, or an offence specified in Schedule 1 to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the person has a conviction in a place outside Hong Kong—

subparagraph.content: for an offence in respect of an act that would have constituted an offence specified in paragraph (a) had it been done in Hong Kong;
for an offence relating to money laundering or terrorist financing; or
for an offence for which it was necessary to find that the person had acted fraudulently, corruptly or dishonestly;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the person has failed to comply with a requirement imposed under this Ordinance or a regulation made under section 53ZVS;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: if the person is a corporation, whether it is in liquidation or is the subject of a winding up order, or there is a receiver appointed in relation to it.

section.name: s53ZUO
section.heading: Application for and grant of registration

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application, register a person as a Category B registrant for carrying on a precious metals and stones business that includes the carrying out of specified transactions and specified cash transactions.
The Commissioner may register a person as a Category B registrant only if the Commissioner is satisfied of the matters specified in subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (2) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is an individual—

subparagraph.content: the individual is a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a partnership—

subparagraph.content: each partner in the partnership is a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business; and
if there is an ultimate owner in relation to the partnership—the ultimate owner is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a corporation—

subparagraph.content: each director of the corporation is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business; and
if there is an ultimate owner in relation to the corporation—the ultimate owner is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business.

subsection.content: The matter specified for the purposes of subsection (2) is that, in relation to an applicant who intends to use any domestic premises as business premises, the applicant has secured the written consent of every occupant of the premises for any authorized person, as defined by section 8, to enter the premises for the purpose of exercising the powers under section 9.
Section 53ZUN applies to a determination of an application under subsection (1).
On registering a person as a Category B registrant, the Commissioner may impose any conditions that the Commissioner considers appropriate.
Section 53ZUS applies to an application under subsection (1) and to the determination of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 53ZUU, registration of a person under this section have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Commissioner considers it appropriate in any particular case—for any other period determined by the Commissioner, beginning on the date on which the registration takes effect.

section.name: s53ZUP
section.heading: Certificate of registration and branch certificates

subsection.leadIn: On granting a person’s application for registration as a Category B registrant, the Commissioner must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the person’s name in the register and specify that the person is a Category B registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a branch certificate for each branch of the registrant (if any).

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of registration issued in respect of a person registered as a Category B registrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state that the person is so registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be in a form specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must specify the address of the principal place of business of the registrant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must specify the period for which the registration has effect.

subsection.content: A branch certificate issued for a branch of a Category B registrant must be in a form specified by the Commissioner and must specify the address of the branch.

section.name: s53ZUQ
section.heading: Renewal of registration as Category B registrant

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application by a Category B registrant, renew the registration of the registrant.
The application must be made at least 60 days before the registration is due to expires.
Sections 53ZUN, 53ZUO(2), (3), (4) and (7) and 53ZUP apply to an application for a renewal of the registration as they apply to an application for registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the registration expires before the determination of the application, unless the application is withdrawn or the registration is cancelled or suspended, the registration remains in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until it is renewed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is not renewed, until the decision not to renew takes effect as a specified decision under section 75.

subsection.leadIn: On renewing a Category B registration, the Commissioner may, if the Commissioner considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any new conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend any previously imposed conditions; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove any previously imposed conditions.

subsection.leadIn: A renewal takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the day following the expiry of the registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (4) applies, on the day following the day on which the registration would have expired but for that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 53ZUU, the registration of a person as a Category B registrant, if renewed, has effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for 3 years beginning on the date on which the registration is renewed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the Commissioner considers it appropriate in any particular case—for any other period—

subparagraph.content: determined by the Commissioner; and
beginning on the date on which the registration is renewed.

section.name: s53ZUR
section.heading: Amendment of conditions of registration

subsection.leadIn: In relation to the registration of a person as a Category B registrant, the Commissioner may, at any time, if satisfied that it is reasonable to do so in the circumstances—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any new conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend any previously imposed conditions; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove any previously imposed conditions.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUS applies to a decision made under subsection (1).

section.name: s53ZUS
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to sections 53ZUO, 53ZUQ and 53ZUR

subsection.leadIn: An application for the grant or renewal of registration as a Category B registrant must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in the form and way specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3K.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1)(a), an application for the grant or renewal of registration as a Category B registrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a copy of a valid business registration certificate of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the address of each premises that the applicant intends to be used as business premises and the applicant’s correspondence address.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (4) and (5) apply if the Commissioner decides to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose a condition on granting the registration of a person as a Category B registrant under section 53ZUO(6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a new condition or amend or remove a condition on renewing the registration of a person as a Category B registrant under section 53ZUQ(5); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the registration of a person as a Category B registrant, impose a new condition or amend or remove a condition in any other case under section 53ZUR(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must inform the person of the decision referred to in subsection (3) by written notice and the notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the registrant may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The imposition, amendment or removal of a condition referred to in subsection (3) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (3)(a) applies—at the time the registration takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (3)(b) or (c) applies—at the time the notice is given under subsection (4) or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is later.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner decides not to grant or renew the registration of a person as a Category B registrant, the Commissioner must inform the person of the decision by written notice and the notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the person may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

section.name: s53ZUT
section.heading: Cessation of registration
section.leadIn: The registration of a person as a Category B registrant ceases to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registrant notifies the Commissioner that the registrant has the intention referred to in section 53ZVB(2)(a) or (b)—on the intended date of cessation (as defined by section 53ZVB(3)) as notified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Commissioner has approved an application by the registrant to be registered as a Category A registrant under section 53ZUF;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registrant is an individual—on the death of the individual;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the registrant is a partnership—on the dissolution of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the registrant is a corporation—on the commencement of winding up of the corporation.

section.name: s53ZUU
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of registration

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a person registered as a Category B registrant, the Commissioner may in any of the situations specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the person’s registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the person’s registration for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: The situations are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person contravenes any of the conditions of the person’s registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is an individual, the Commissioner is no longer satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: the individual is a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a partnership, the Commissioner is no longer satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: each partner in the partnership is a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a corporation, the Commissioner is no longer satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: each director of the corporation is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the person ceases to hold a valid business registration certificate; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the person uses any domestic premises as business premises for its precious metals and stones business, and—

subparagraph.content: any occupant of the premises revokes his or her written consent previously given for any authorized person, as defined by section 8, to enter the premises for the purpose of exercising the powers under section 9; or
any new occupant of the premises refuses to give such a written consent.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUN applies to a determination under subsection (2)(b), (c) or (d).
The Commissioner may exercise a power under subsection (1) in relation to a person only after giving the person a reasonable opportunity to be heard.

section.name: s53ZUV
section.heading: Supplementary provisions on cancellation or suspension of registration

subsection.leadIn: On deciding to cancel or suspend the registration of a person as a Category B registrant (affected person) under section 53ZUU, the Commissioner must inform the affected person of the decision by written notice and the notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include a statement of the reasons for the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a decision to suspend registration, specify the duration and terms of the suspension; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: include a statement that the affected person may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

subsection.content: Any fee paid for the grant or renewal of registration as a Category B registrant is not refundable on the cancellation or suspension of the registration.

If the registration of the affected person is cancelled under section 53ZUU, the certificate of registration and each branch certificate (if any) in respect of the affected person cease to have effect from the day on which the cancellation takes effect as a specified decision under section 75.

section.name: s53ZUW
section.heading: Approval required for becoming ultimate owner of Category B registrant

subsection.content: A person must not become an ultimate owner of a Category B registrant unless the Commissioner has given approval in writing.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may give approval only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Category B registrant makes an application for the approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner is satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUN applies to a determination under subsection (2)(b).
Section 53ZUZ applies to an application under subsection (2)(a) and to the determination of the application.
A person who, without reasonable excuses, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53ZUX
section.heading: Approval required for becoming partner of Category B registrant

subsection.content: A person must not become a partner of a Category B registrant that is a partnership unless the Commissioner has given approval in writing.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may give approval only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Category B registrant makes an application for the approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner is satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to carry on a precious metals and stones business.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUN applies to a determination under subsection (2)(b).
Section 53ZUZ applies to an application under subsection (2)(a) and to the determination of the application.
A person who, without reasonable excuses, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53ZUY
section.heading: Approval required for becoming director of Category B registrant

subsection.content: A person must not become a director of a Category B registrant that is a corporation unless the Commissioner has given approval in writing.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may give approval only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Category B registrant makes an application for the approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner is satisfied that the person is a fit and proper person to be associated with a precious metals and stones business.

subsection.content: Section 53ZUN applies to a determination under subsection (2)(b).
Section 53ZUZ apply to an application under subsection (2)(a) and to the determination of the application.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s53ZUZ
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to sections 53ZUW, 53ZUX and 53ZUY

subsection.leadIn: An application for an approval of the Commissioner under section 53ZUW, 53ZUX or 53ZUY—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the form and way specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3K.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner decides not to give the approval applied for by a Category B registrant under section 53ZUW, 53ZUX or 53ZUY, the Commissioner must inform the registrant of the decision by written notice and the notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the registrant may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Registrant’s Duty to Display Certificate and Give Notifications

section.name: s53ZV
section.heading: Display of certificate of registration

subsection.content: A registrant must display the certificate of registration in a conspicuous place at the principal place of business of the registrant.
A registrant must display, in a conspicuous place at each branch of the registrant (if any), the branch certificate concerned.

If a certificate of registration or a branch certificate is issued in the form of an electronic record, the registrant concerned is to be regarded as complying with subsection (1) or (2) (as the case requires) if the registrant display a printed copy of the certificate in the manner described in subsection (1) or (2) (as the case requires).

A registrant who carries on a precious metals and stones business, on a website through the Internet or by other electronic means, must provide on the website or other electronic means a means specified by the Commissioner for verifying the registrant’s status as such.
A registrant who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify that a registrant of a description specified in the notice is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (1) or (2) if the registrant displays a certificate of registration or a branch certificate in the manner specified in the notice.
A notice published under subsection (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s53ZVA
section.heading: Notification of changes of particulars

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a registrant, this section applies to the following (specified particulars)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the particulars that the registrant has provided to the Commissioner in connection with an application under this Part for—

subparagraph.content: registration as a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant; or
renewal of registration as a Category B registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other particulars notified under this section.

subsection.content: Within 1 month of beginning on the day on which a change in any specified particulars occurs in relation to a registrant, the registrant must notify the Commissioner, in writing, of the change.
A registrant who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: If a change notified under subsection (2) relates to any particulars specified in a certificate of registration or a branch certificate (earlier certificate)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner may issue, for replacement, a certificate of registration or a branch certificate (as the case requires) containing the particulars as changed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the earlier certificate ceases to have effect from the day on which a certificate is issued under paragraph (a) for replacing it.

subsection.content: The Commissioner must, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving the notification under subsection (2), amend any specified particulars in the register if necessary.

section.name: s53ZVB
section.heading: Notification of intended cessation of business etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is a Category A registrant must notify the Commissioner, in writing, if the person intends—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to cease to carry on the person’s precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to cease to carry out specified transactions while carrying on the person’s precious metals and stones business.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is a Category B registrant must notify the Commissioner, in writing, if the person intends—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to cease to carry on the person’s precious metals and stones business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to cease to carry out specified transactions and specified cash transactions while carrying on the person’s precious metals and stones business.

subsection.content: The notification must be given before the date on which the cessation is to take effect (intended date of cessation).

subsection.leadIn: The notification must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s intention as referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intended date of cessation.

subsection.content: The Commissioner must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the intended date of cessation, as notified, remove the relevant particulars from the register.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
Any fee paid for the grant or renewal of the registration of a person is not refundable on the cancellation of the registration.
The certificate of registration and each branch certificate (if any) in respect of the person cease to have effect from the intended date of cessation, as notified.

section.name: s53ZVC
section.heading: How to give notifications
section.leadIn: A notification under this Division must be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the way specified by the Commissioner.

section.name: s53ZVD
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 6
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: disciplinary power (紀律處分權力) means a power that may be exercised by the Commissioner under section 53ZVE or 53ZVF.

section.name: s53ZVE
section.heading: Disciplinary action against Category A registrant

subsection.content: Subject to section 53ZVG, the Commissioner may, in any of the situations specified in subsection (2), exercise, in respect of the Category A registrant, one or more of the powers specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The situations are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a Category A registrant contravenes—

subparagraph.content: a regulation made under section 53ZVS; or
a condition of the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a contravention of section 53ZV, 53ZVA or 53ZVB.

subsection.leadIn: The powers are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to publicly reprimand the registrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to order the registrant to take, by a date specified by the Commissioner, any action specified by the Commissioner for the purpose of remedying the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: After a decision to exercise a disciplinary power takes effect as a specified decision under section 75, the Commissioner may disclose to the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: details of the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for which the decision was made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any material facts relating to the case.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may exercise a disciplinary power only after giving the registrant a reasonable opportunity to be heard.

section.name: s53ZVF
section.heading: Disciplinary action against Category B registrant

subsection.content: Subject to sections 53ZVG and 53ZVH, the Commissioner may, in any of the situations specified in subsection (2), exercise, in respect of the Category B registrant, one or more of the powers specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The situations are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a Category B registrant contravenes—

subparagraph.content: a requirement set out in Schedule 2 that applies to DNFBP who is a Category B registrant;
a regulation made under section 53ZVS; and
a condition of the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a contravention of section 53ZUW, 53ZUX, 53ZUY, 53ZV, 53ZVA or 53ZVB.

subsection.leadIn: The powers are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to publicly reprimand the registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to order the registrant to take, by a date specified by the Commissioner (compliance deadline), any action specified by the Commissioner for the purpose of remedying the contravention (remedial action); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to order the registrant to pay a pecuniary penalty not exceeding $500,000.

subsection.content: If a Category B registrant fails to comply with an order to take remedial action, the Commissioner may further order the registrant to pay a daily pecuniary penalty not exceeding $10,000 for each day on which the failure continues after the compliance deadline.

subsection.leadIn: A Category B registrant who is ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty under this section must pay the penalty to the Commissioner within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 30 days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a longer period specified in the notice referred to in section 53ZVG,

subsection.continued: after the order takes effect as a specified decision under section 75.

subsection.leadIn: After a decision to exercise a disciplinary power takes effect as a specified decision under section 75, the Commissioner may disclose to the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: details of the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for which the decision was made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any material facts relating to the case.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may exercise a disciplinary power only after giving the registrant a reasonable opportunity to be heard.

section.name: s53ZVG
section.heading: Notice regarding exercise of disciplinary powers
section.leadIn: If the Commissioner decides to exercise a disciplinary power in respect of a registrant under section 53ZVE or 53ZVF, the Commissioner must inform the registrant of the decision by written notice and the notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include a statement of the reasons for the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any action that the registrant is required to take under the decision;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a decision to publicly reprimand, specify the terms in which the registrant is to be reprimanded;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a decision to impose a pecuniary penalty on a Category B registrant—

subparagraph.content: specify the amount of the penalty; and
if the penalty is to be paid within a period other than that referred to in section 53ZVF(5)(a), specify that other period within which it must be paid; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: include a statement that the registrant may apply to the Review Tribunal for a review of the decision.

section.name: s53ZVH
section.heading: Guidelines for imposing pecuniary penalty on Category B registrant

subsection.content: The Commissioner must publish guidelines indicating the way in which the Commissioner proposes to exercise the disciplinary power to impose a pecuniary penalty on a Category B registrant under section 53ZVF.

subsection.leadIn: The guidelines must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: published before the Commissioner exercises a disciplinary power to impose a pecuniary penalty for the first time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: published in the Gazette and in any other way that the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.content: In exercising the disciplinary power to impose a pecuniary penalty, the Commissioner must have regard to the published guidelines.
The guidelines are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s53ZVI
section.heading: Registration of pecuniary penalty order

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may, on application made by the Commissioner, register in that Court an order to pay a pecuniary penalty.
The application must be made by producing to the Registrar of the High Court a written notice, requesting that the order be registered, together with the original and a copy of the order.
On registration, the order is to be regarded for all purposes as an order of the Court of First Instance made within the civil jurisdiction of that Court for the payment of money.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: pecuniary penalty (罰款) means a pecuniary penalty ordered to be paid under section 53ZVF(3)(c) or (4).

section.name: s53ZVJ
section.heading: Application of disciplinary powers in respect of directors of Category B registrants

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner exercises a disciplinary power in respect of a Category B registrant that is a corporation in connection with a contravention referred to in section 53ZVF(2)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the contravention was caused or allowed by a director of the corporation; or
the director failed to take reasonable steps to prevent the contravention.

subsection.content: A disciplinary power is also exercisable by the Commissioner in respect of the director as if the director were a Category B registrant.
This Division is to be construed accordingly.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Non-Hong Kong Precious Metals and Stones Dealers

section.name: s53ZVK
section.heading: Non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer must file cash transaction report

subsection.content: A non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer must give to the Commissioner a report, in respect of any specified cash transaction carried out by the dealer, in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The report must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given in the form specified by the Commissioner and in the way specified by Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information set out in Schedule 3J; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be given as soon as practicable and in any event before the earlier of the following—

subparagraph.content: the expiry of 1 day after the transaction;
the earliest time when a specified individual leaves Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a level 5 fine and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedIndividual
def.leadIn: specified individual (指明個人), in relation to a specified cash transaction carried out by a non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer, means each of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the dealer if the dealer is an individual and is in Hong Kong at the time of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual acting on behalf of the dealer in the transaction.

section.name: s53ZVL
section.heading: Commissioner may appoint authorized officers
section.content: The Commissioner may appoint, in writing, a public officer employed in the Customs and Excise Department to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s53ZVM
section.heading: Magistrate’s warrant to enter premises
