subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to take the actions referred to in subsection (2) if satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an offence under section 53ZUE or 53ZVK—

subparagraph.content: is being committed on any premises; or
has been committed on any premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is or may be on any premises anything that is or contains evidence of an offence under section 53ZUE or 53ZVK.

subsection.leadIn: The actions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter and search the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to seize, remove or detain—

subparagraph.leadIn: any record or document, or any cash or other article, found on the premises that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is, or appears to the authorized officer to be or to contain, evidence of the commission of the suspected offence; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: appears to the authorized officer to be likely to be or to contain the evidence; and
anything that the authorized officer has reasonable cause to believe may be required as evidence in proceedings for the suspected offence.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer authorized under the warrant may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: call on any person to assist the officer in entering and searching the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: break into and forcibly enter the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove by force any person or thing obstructing the officer in the exercise of those powers; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: detain any person found on the premises who appears to the officer to be, or to be likely to be, able to give information relevant to the investigation of the suspected offence until the premises have been searched.

subsection.content: An authorized officer who enters any premises under this section must, if required, produce the warrant for inspection.

A person who obstructs an authorized officer in the exercise of a power conferred under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a person appointed as an authorized officer under section 53ZVL.

section.name: s53ZVN
section.heading: Power to require production of material in legible form

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to any information or matter (material) contained in a record or document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is found on any premises entered under a warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not in a legible form or is in an information system.

subsection.content: If the material that is not in a legible form can be reproduced in a legible form, the authorized officer may require a person referred to in subsection (4) to produce the material or the relevant part of it in a legible form.

If the material is in an information system, the authorized officer may require a person specified in subsection (4) to produce the material or the relevant part of it in a form that enables it to be reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified for the purposes of subsections (2) and (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who appears to the authorized officer to be in charge of the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who appears to the authorized officer to be able, or likely to be able, to produce the material—

subparagraph.content: in a legible form; or
in a form that enables it to be reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.content: A person who obstructs an authorized officer in the exercise of a power under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means an authorized officer (as defined by section 53ZVM(6)) authorized by a warrant issued under section 53ZVM.

section.name: s53ZVO
section.heading: Authorized officer’s power to arrest and search etc.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may, without a warrant, arrest a person or detain a person for further enquiries if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorized officer has reasonable grounds to suspect that the person has committed, or is committing, an offence under section 53ZUE or 53ZVK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the authorized officer has reasonable grounds to suspect that the person has committed or is committing an offence under this Part, other than an offence under section 53ZUE or 53ZVK, and it appears to the authorized officer that service of a summons is impracticable because—

subparagraph.content: the name of the person is unknown to, and cannot readily be ascertained by, the authorized officer;
the person has failed to give a satisfactory address for service of the summons; or
the authorized officer has reasonable grounds to suspect that an address given by the person as an address for service of the summons is not a valid address.

subsection.content: An authorized officer who arrests or detains a person under this section must, if requested, produce evidence of his or her appointment as an authorized officer.
An authorized officer who arrests a person under subsection (1) must take the person to a police station to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

However, if further inquiries are necessary, an authorized officer may first take the person to an office of the Customs and Excise Service for further inquiries and then to a police station to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).
A person, whether arrested or not, must not be detained for more than 48 hours without being charged and brought before a magistrate.
If a person forcibly resists, or attempts to evade, arrest or detention under this section, the authorized officer may use any force that is reasonably necessary to effect the arrest or detention.

subsection.leadIn: if an authorized officer has arrested a person under this section, the officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: search the person, or the place at which the person has been arrested and its surrounding areas, for anything that may be related to the suspected offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take possession of anything found as a result of the exercise of the power under paragraph (a) that the authorized officer has reasonable grounds to suspect is related to the suspected offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a person appointed as an authorized officer under section 53ZVL.

section.name: s53ZVP
section.heading: How this Ordinance applies to hawker

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who is a hawker holding a hawker licence in relation to the carrying on of a precious metals and stones business.

A requirement under this Part for an application under this Part to be accompanied by a copy of a valid business registration certificate is taken to be complied with, in respect of an application made by the person, if the application is accompanied by a copy of the hawker licence.

subsection.leadIn: If the person is registered as a registrant by relying on subsection (2), a reference in this Ordinance to a registrant ceasing to hold a valid business registration certificate is taken to mean—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person ceasing to hold the hawker licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s hawker licence being suspended under section 125(1)(b) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132).

subsection.leadIn: If the person is registered as a registrant by relying on subsection (2), a reference in this Ordinance to premises used for the purpose of the carrying out of face-to-face transactions with customers or business premises or a place of business is taken to include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the location of the fixed pitch from which the person may hawk, as specified in the licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the areas in which the person may hawk, as specified in the licence.

subsection.content: Subject to any necessary modifications, this Ordinance applies accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: hawker licence (小販牌照) means a licence issued under Part 2 of the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI).

section.name: s53ZVQ
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules 3H to 3K

subsection.content: The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 3H and 3I.
The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 3J and 3K.

section.name: s53ZVR
section.heading: Commissioner may waive fee
section.content: The Commissioner may, in relation to any person or class of persons, waive, in whole or in part, the payment of any fee under this Part.

section.name: s53ZVS
section.heading: Regulations
section.content: The Commissioner of Customs and Excise may make regulations for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Part.

section.name: s53ZVT
section.heading: Offence of providing false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person in a specified document or for a specified purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person in a specified document or for a specified purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the material particular is omitted from the statement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedDocument
def.leadIn: specified document (指明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made to the Commissioner under this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notification given to the Commissioner under this Part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document provided to the Commissioner for any purpose under this Part;

subsection.def: specified purpose (指明目的) means a purpose in connection with an application made to the Commissioner under this Part or a notification given to the Commissioner under this Part.

section.name: s53ZVU
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution
section.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings may be instituted for an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Part within 12 months after the offence is discovered by the Commissioner.

section.name: s53ZW
section.heading: Transitional arrangements for existing dealer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an existing precious metals and stones dealer, that is to say a person who immediately before 1 April 2023—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been carrying on a precious metals and stones business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for that purpose, held a valid business registration certificate.

subsection.content: An existing precious metals and stones dealer is deemed to be a Category B registrant with effect from 1 April 2023, and this Ordinance applies in relation to the dealer accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who is a deemed registrant does not apply for registration as a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant during the transitional period, the person ceases to be a deemed registrant when the earliest of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transitional period ends;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person has notified the Commissioner that the person has the intention referred to in section 53ZVB(2)(a) or (b)—the intended date of cessation (as defined by section 53ZVB(3)), as notified, begins;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person ceases to hold a valid business registration certificate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an event referred to in section 53ZUT(c), (d) or (e) occurs in relation to the person.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who is a deemed registrant applies for registration as a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant during the transitional period, the person ceases to be a deemed registrant when the earliest of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner registers the person as a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner’s decision not to register the person takes effect as a specified decision under section 75;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application to register is withdrawn;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person has notified the Commissioner that the person has the intention referred to in section 53ZVB(2)(a) or (b)—the intended date of cessation (as defined by section 53ZVB(3)), as notified, begins;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person ceases to hold a valid business registration certificate;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an event referred to in section 53ZUT(c), (d) or (e) occurs in relation to the person.

subsection.leadIn: If the deemed registrant is an individual in relation to whom there is an ultimate owner—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: this Ordinance applies in relation to the ultimate owner accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If the deemed registrant is a partnership—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: each partner of the partnership is deemed to have been approved under section 53ZUX while the partnership remains to be a deemed registrant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: this Ordinance applies in relation to the ultimate owner and each partner accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If the deemed registrant is a corporation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: each director of the corporation is deemed to have been approved under section 53ZUY while the corporation remains to be a deemed registrant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: this Ordinance applies in relation to the ultimate owner and each director accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: deemed registrant (當作註冊人) means a person who is deemed to be a Category B registrant under subsection (2);
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 9 months beginning on 1 April 2023.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal

section.name: s54
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: application for review (覆核申請) means an application made under section 59(1);

def.name: Parties
def.leadIn: parties (各方), in relation to a review, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified authority that made the specified decision in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who makes the application for review;

section.def: review (覆核) means a review of a specified decision by the Tribunal under section 60(1);
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury;

def.name: SpecifiedAuthority
def.leadIn: specified authority (指明當局)—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision falling within paragraph (c) of the definition of specified decision, means the Insurance Authority; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 20)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision falling within paragraph (d) of the definition of specified decision, means the Commissioner; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 20; 15 of 2022 s. 27)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision falling within paragraph (e) of the definition of specified decision, means the Registrar; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 20)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision falling within paragraph (f) of the definition of specified decision, means the Securities and Futures Commission; and (Added 15 of 2022 s. 27)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision falling within paragraph (g) of the definition of specified decision, means the Commissioner; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 27)

def.name: SpecifiedDecision
def.leadIn: specified decision (指明決定) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Monetary Authority to exercise any of the powers under section 21;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Securities and Futures Commission to exercise any of the powers under section 21;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision of the Insurance Authority to exercise any of the powers under section 21;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Commissioner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to exercise any of the powers under section 21;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to impose a licence condition under section 30;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to refuse to grant a licence under section 30;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: to amend or impose a licence condition under section 31;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: to refuse to renew a licence under section 31;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: to amend or impose a licence condition under section 32;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: to revoke or suspend a licence under section 34;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: to refuse to give approval to a person becoming a director of a licensee under section 35;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: to refuse to give approval to a person becoming an ultimate owner of a licensee under section 36;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: to refuse to give approval to a person becoming a partner in a partnership that is a licensee under section 37;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: to refuse to grant an application to add new premises to a licence under section 38;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: to refuse to grant an application to operate a money service at particular premises under section 39; or
to exercise any of the powers under section 43;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: not to grant a licence under section 53H;
to impose a licence condition under section 53J;
not to renew a licence under section 53K;
to amend or impose a licence condition under section 53L or 53M;
to revoke or suspend a licence under section 53Q;
not to give approval for a person to become an ultimate owner of a licensee under section 53S;
not to give approval for a person to become a partner of a licensee under section 53T;
not to give approval for a person to become a director of a licensee under section 53U; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Securities and Futures Commission—

subparagraph.content: to refuse to grant a licence under section 53ZRK;
to impose a condition on, or amend or remove a condition of, a licence under section 53ZRK;
to refuse to grant a licence under section 53ZRL;
to impose a condition on, or amend or remove a condition of, a licence under section 53ZRL;
to refuse to approve an accreditation or transfer of an accreditation under section 53ZRM;

to refuse to approve a person as a responsible officer of a licensed VAS provider under section 53ZRP or to refuse to approve a person to become an ultimate owner of a licensed VAS provider under section 53ZRQ;

to impose a condition in approving a person as a responsible officer of a licensed VAS provider under section 53ZRP or to amend or remove a condition in relation to the approval of a person as such a responsible officer under that section;

to impose a condition in approving a person to become an ultimate owner of a licensed VAS provider under section 53ZRQ or to amend or remove a condition in relation to the approval of such an ultimate owner under that section;
to refuse to approve premises under section 53ZRR;
to revoke or suspend a licence, or the approval of a person as a responsible officer, under section 53ZSP or 53ZSQ (section 53ZSQ(2)(d) excepted); or

to impose a prohibition or requirement under section 53ZSZ, 53ZT or 53ZTA or to substitute or vary, or to refuse to withdraw, substitute or vary, a prohibition or requirement under section 53ZTB; or (Added 15 of 2022 s. 27)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Commissioner—

subparagraph.content: not to register a person as a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant under section 53ZUF or 53ZUO;
not to renew a person’s registration as a Category B registrant under section 53ZUQ;
not to approve a person to become an ultimate owner, a partner or a director of a Category B registrant under section 53ZUW, 53ZUX or 53ZUY; or

section.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal established by section 55. (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 20)

division.name: D2
division.heading: Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal

section.name: s55
section.heading: Establishment of Tribunal

subsection.content: There is established a tribunal to be known as the “Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal” in English and “打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集覆核審裁處” in Chinese. (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 22)

The Tribunal has jurisdiction to review specified decisions and to hear and determine any question or issue arising out of or in connection with any review, in accordance with this Part and Schedule 4.

If the Secretary considers it appropriate to do so, the Secretary may establish additional tribunals for the purposes of any reviews, and the provisions of this Ordinance apply, with necessary modifications, to each of those additional tribunals as they apply to the Tribunal.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Composition of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in Schedule 4, the Tribunal consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 other members,

subsection.continued: appointed by the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson of the Tribunal must be a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is eligible for appointment as a judge of the High Court under section 9 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a public officer or is a public officer by virtue only of being the chairperson of a board or tribunal established under an Ordinance.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Chairperson and other members of Tribunal may be paid fees

subsection.content: The chairperson and other members of the Tribunal may be paid a fee for their services in an amount that the Secretary considers appropriate.
The amounts payable under this section are a charge on the general revenue.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Schedule 4 has effect

subsection.content: Schedule 4 has effect with respect to the Tribunal.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 4.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Application for review of specified decisions

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by a specified decision made in relation to the person may apply to the Tribunal for a review of the decision within the period ending 21 days after the notice informing the person of the decision has been sent.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1) and subject to subsection (3), on an application by a person who is aggrieved by a specified decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal may by order extend the time within which an application for review of the specified decision may be made under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the making of the order, the time within which the application may be made under subsection (1) is extended accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may only grant an extension under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the applicant and the specified authority have been given a reasonable opportunity to be heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is satisfied that there is a good cause for granting the extension.

subsection.leadIn: An application for review—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the grounds for the application.

subsection.content: The Tribunal must, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving an application for review, send a copy of the application to the specified authority.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Determination of review by Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may determine a review of a specified decision by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirming, varying or setting aside the decision and, if the decision is set aside, substituting for the decision any other decision that the Tribunal considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remitting the matter to the specified authority with any directions it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Tribunal varies, or substitutes any other decision for, a specified decision under subsection (1)(a), the decision as varied or the other decision substituting for the specified decision may be any decision (whether more or less onerous than the decision varied or substituted) that the specified authority had power to make in respect of the person who makes the application for review in question, whether or not under the same provision as that under which the specified decision has been made.
In reviewing a specified decision, the Tribunal must give the parties to the review a reasonable opportunity to be heard.
For the purposes of proceedings before the Tribunal, matters of fact are to be established on a balance of probabilities.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Powers of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Subject to Schedule 4, the Tribunal may, for the purposes of a review, on its own initiative or on the application of any party to the review—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material by way of oral evidence, written statements or documents, whether or not the material would be admissible in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the manner in which any material mentioned in paragraph (a) is received;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing signed by the chairperson of the Tribunal, require a person to attend before it at any sitting and to give evidence and produce any article, record or document in the person’s possession or control relating to the subject matter of the review;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: administer oaths;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: examine or cause to be examined on oath or otherwise a person attending before it and require the person to answer truthfully any question that the Tribunal considers appropriate for the purpose of the review;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: order a witness to provide evidence for the purpose of the review by affidavit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: order a person not to publish or otherwise disclose any material the Tribunal receives;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: prohibit the publication or disclosure of any material the Tribunal receives at any sitting, or any part of a sitting, that is held in private;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: stay any of the proceedings in the review on any grounds and on any terms and conditions that it considers appropriate having regard to the interests of justice; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the procedure to be followed in the review.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made, given or imposed under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupts any sitting of the Tribunal or otherwise misbehaves during any sitting of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having been required by the Tribunal under subsection (1) to attend before the Tribunal, leaves the place where the person’s attendance is so required without the permission of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hinders or deters any person from attending before the Tribunal, giving evidence or producing any article, record or document, for the purpose of a review;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any person who has attended before the Tribunal, on account of that attendance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by the chairperson, or any other member, of the Tribunal at any time on account of the performance of the chairperson’s or member’s functions in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made, given or imposed under subsection (1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence given under compulsion

subsection.content: This section applies to any evidence, answer or information given or provided by a person in accordance with a requirement or order of the Tribunal imposed or made under section 61(1)(c), (e) or (f).

Despite anything in this Ordinance and subject to subsection (3), neither the evidence, answer or information given or provided by the person nor the requirement or order imposed or made by the Tribunal is admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law.

Subsection (2) does not apply to criminal proceedings in which the person is charged with an offence under section 61(2)(a), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), in respect of the evidence, answer or information. (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 28)

section.name: s63
section.heading: Contempt dealt with by Tribunal

subsection.content: The Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt.

Without limiting the powers of the Tribunal under subsection (1), the Tribunal has the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt, as if it were contempt of court, a person who, without reasonable excuse, engages in any conduct falling within section 61(2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f).

The Tribunal must, in the exercise of its powers to punish for contempt under this section, adopt the same standard of proof as the Court of First Instance in the exercise of the same powers to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no power may be exercised under this section to determine whether to punish a person for contempt in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 61(2) in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending or because of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person under that section in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under section 61(2) in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any power has previously been exercised under this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: proceedings arising from the exercise of that power remain pending or because of the previous exercise of that power, no power may again be lawfully exercised under this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Privileged information
section.content: This Part and Schedule 4 do not require an authorized institution, acting as the banker or financial adviser of a person who makes an application for review, to disclose information in relation to the affairs of any of its customers other than that person.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Costs

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may, in relation to a review, by order award to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person whose attendance, whether or not as a witness, has been necessary or required for the purposes of the review; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any party to the review,

subsection.continued: any sum that it considers appropriate in respect of the costs reasonably incurred by the person, or the party, in relation to the review and the application for review in question.

subsection.leadIn: Costs awarded under subsection (1) must be paid by, and are recoverable as a civil debt from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if they are awarded to a person under subsection (1)(a), any party to the review that the Tribunal considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if they are awarded to a party to the review under subsection (1)(b), the other party to the review.

subsection.content: Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the award of costs, and to the taxation of any costs awarded, by the Tribunal under subsection (1).

section.name: s66
section.heading: Notification of Tribunal determinations

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal must, as soon as reasonably practicable after completing a review, deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its determination and the reasons for the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order made under section 65 in relation to the review and the reasons for the order.

subsection.leadIn: If a sitting, or any part of a sitting, of the Tribunal relating to a review is held in private, the Tribunal may by order prohibit the publication or disclosure of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its determination, or the reasons for the determination, referred to in subsection (1)(a), or any part of the determination or reasons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order, or the reasons for an order, referred to in subsection (1)(b), or any part of such an order or any part of the reasons for such an order.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order of the Tribunal made under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Form and proof of orders of Tribunal

subsection.content: An order made by the Tribunal must be recorded in writing and be signed by the chairperson of the Tribunal.

A document purporting to be an order of the Tribunal signed by the chairperson of the Tribunal is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, presumed to be an order of the Tribunal duly made and signed, without proof of its making, or proof of signature, or proof that the person signing the order was in fact the chairperson of the Tribunal.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Orders of Tribunal may be registered in Court of First Instance

subsection.content: After receiving a notice in writing given by the Tribunal in the manner prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice under section 76, the Court of First Instance may register an order of the Tribunal in the Court of First Instance.
An order registered under subsection (1) is to be regarded for all purposes as an order of the Court of First Instance made within the jurisdiction of that Court.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Applications for stay of execution of specified decisions

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the making of an application for review does not by itself operate as a stay of execution of the specified decision to which the application relates.

A person who makes an application for review or an application under section 59(2) may, at any time before the review or the application is determined by the Tribunal, apply to the Tribunal for a stay of execution of the specified decision to which the application relates.
The Tribunal must, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving an application under subsection (2), conduct a hearing to determine the application.
The Tribunal may by order grant the stay subject to any condition as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or other matters that the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Applications for stay of execution of determinations of Tribunal

subsection.content: A party to a review may, at any time after the determination of the review by the Tribunal, apply to the Tribunal for a stay of execution of the determination.

On an application under subsection (1), the Tribunal may by order grant the stay subject to any condition as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or other matters that the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Appeal to Court of Appeal with leave

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if a party to a review is dissatisfied with the determination of the review, the party may appeal to the Court of Appeal against the determination on a question of law or a question of fact or a question of mixed law and fact.
No appeal may be made under subsection (1) unless leave to appeal has been granted by the Court of Appeal.

subsection.leadIn: Leave to appeal for the purpose of subsection (2) may be granted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of a particular issue arising out of the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any condition that the Court of Appeal considers necessary in order to secure the just, expeditious and economical disposal of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: Leave to appeal for the purpose of subsection (2) may only be granted if the Court of Appeal is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appeal has a reasonable prospect of success; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is some other reason in the interests of justice why the appeal should be heard.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Powers of the Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: The Court of Appeal may, in relation to an appeal against a determination of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary or set aside the determination and, if the determination is set aside, substitute for the determination any other determination that it considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remit the matter to the Tribunal or to the specified authority with any directions it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Court of Appeal varies, or substitutes any other determination for, a determination under subsection (1)(c), the determination as varied or the other determination substituting for the determination may be any determination (whether more or less onerous than the determination varied or substituted) that the Tribunal had power to make in respect of the review in question, whether or not under the same provision as that under which the determination has been made.
In an appeal under this section, the Court of Appeal may make any order for payment of costs as it considers appropriate.

section.name: s73
section.heading: No stay of execution of Tribunal’s determination on appeal

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 70, the lodging of an appeal under section 71 does not by itself operate as a stay of execution of the determination of the Tribunal appealed against.

If an appeal is lodged under section 71, the Court of Appeal may, on an application made to it by any party to the review, order a stay of execution of the determination of the Tribunal appealed against.

The Court of Appeal may, when making an order under subsection (2), impose any condition that the Court of Appeal considers appropriate, including conditions as to costs and payment of money into the Tribunal.

section.name: s74
section.heading: No other right of appeal
section.content: Subject to section 50 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) and section 71, the determination of the Tribunal is final and is not subject to appeal.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Time when specified decisions take effect

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, a specified decision takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where, before the expiry of the period of 21 days specified in section 59(1), the person in relation to whom the decision is made notifies the specified authority in writing that the person will not apply for a review of the decision, at the time the person so notifies the specified authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where, within the period of 21 days specified in section 59(1), the person neither notifies the specified authority that the person will not apply for a review of the decision nor applies for a review of the decision, at the time the period expires; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the person applies for a review of the decision within the period of 21 days specified in section 59(1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal, at the time the decision is so confirmed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the decision is varied, or substituted by another decision, by the Tribunal, at the time the decision is varied or substituted, subject however to the terms of the variation or substitution; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the application is withdrawn, at the time the application is withdrawn.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), the specified authority may, if it considers it appropriate in the public interest to do so in relation to a specified decision, specify in the notice in respect of the decision any time, other than that at which the decision is apart from this subsection to take effect, as the time at which the decision is to take effect, in which case the decision takes effect at the time so specified.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Power of Chief Justice to make rules
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for matters relating to the registration of an order of the Tribunal in the Court of First Instance under section 68(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulating the procedure for the hearing of appeals under section 71.

section.name: s76A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6A
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: information (資料) means a matter, record or document to which section 76B applies;

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a relevant authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is or was a member, an employee, or a consultant, agent or adviser, of a relevant authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is or was—

subparagraph.content: a person appointed under a provision of this Ordinance;
a person performing a function under, or carrying into effect, a provision of this Ordinance; or
a person assisting another person in the performance of a function under, or carrying into effect, a provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s76B
section.heading: Confidentiality

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a matter that comes to a specified person’s knowledge in any of the following circumstances—

subparagraph.content: by virtue of the specified person’s appointment under this Ordinance;
in the course of performing a function under, or carrying into effect, a provision of this Ordinance;
in the course of assisting another person in performing a function under, or carrying into effect, a provision of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a record or document that has come into a specified person’s possession in any of the circumstances mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: A specified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not communicate a matter referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) or (iii) to a person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not allow another person to have access to a record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s76C
section.heading: Permitted disclosures by specified person

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 76B, a specified person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: disclose information—

subparagraph.content: in performing a function under this Ordinance;
for the purpose of carrying into effect a provision of this Ordinance; or
for the purpose of doing anything required or authorized under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disclose information that has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disclose information with a view to the institution of, or for the purposes of, any criminal proceedings in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: disclose information for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving of advice by, counsel, a solicitor or other professional adviser, who is acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: disclose information in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the specified person is a party; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: disclose information in accordance with an order of a court, magistrate or tribunal, or in accordance with a law of Hong Kong or a requirement imposed under a law of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 76B, a person who is or was a section 53ZSH person may disclose information obtained or received by the person in the course of performing the person’s duties as a section 53ZSH person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of an employee or agent of a section 53ZSH auditor, to the auditor.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: section 53ZSH auditor (第53ZSH條核數師) has the meaning given by section 53ZRZ;

def.name: Section53ZSHPerson
def.leadIn: section 53ZSH person (第53ZSH條人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a section 53ZSH auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employee or agent of a section 53ZSH auditor.

section.name: s76D
section.heading: Permitted disclosures by relevant authority

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 76B, a relevant authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose information in the form of a summary compiled from any information in the possession of the relevant authority, including information provided by a person under a provision of this Ordinance, if the summary is so compiled as to prevent particulars relating to the business or identity, or the trading particulars, of any person from being ascertained from it;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: disclose information to the Review Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.content: disclose information with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and, if the information relates to a different person, with the consent also of the person to whom the information relates;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), disclose information to—

subparagraph.content: the Chief Executive;
the Financial Secretary;
the Secretary for Justice;
the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury;
the Monetary Authority;
the Insurance Authority;
the Securities and Futures Commission;
the Commissioner;
the Registrar;
the Official Receiver;
the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;
The Ombudsman;
a public officer authorized under subsection (6);
an inspector appointed by the Financial Secretary to investigate the affairs of a corporation;
the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption;
the Law Society; or
the Estate Agents Authority;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: if the information is obtained by an authorized person under section 9 or an investigator under section 12, disclose information to—

subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;
the Commissioner of Police;
the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption; or
the Review Tribunal;

paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), disclose information to an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong that, in the opinion of the relevant authority—

subparagraph.content: performs, in the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization (recipient jurisdiction), any function similar to a function of a relevant authority or regulatory body under this Ordinance or regulates, supervises or investigates banking, securities, insurance, activities involving virtual assets, or other financial services or legal or accounting services in the recipient jurisdiction; and
is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in the recipient jurisdiction; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: disclose information for the purpose of, or otherwise in connection with, an audit required under section 5F of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) or section 16 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

subsection.leadIn: A relevant authority may disclose information under subsection (1)(g) or (i) only if satisfied that it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the public interest and the interest of the investing public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the recipient’s need for the information in performing the recipient’s functions.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 76B—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Insurance Authority may—

subparagraph.content: disclose information with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any disciplinary proceedings relating to the performance by a Cap. 41 prescribed person of his or her professional duties;
disclose information to a Cap. 41 prescribed person for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Insurance Authority to discharge its functions under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); or

subparagraph.leadIn: disclose any information to an auditor or actuary specified below if, in the opinion of the Insurance Authority, the information is necessary for the auditor or actuary to discharge his or her duties under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an auditor or actuary of an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance broker company; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an auditor appointed under section 95ZF of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) for the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Cap. 41 prescribed person may disclose any information disclosed to that person under paragraph (a)(ii) if the Insurance Authority has given its consent to the disclosure.

subsection.content: A relevant authority may, in disclosing information under subsection (1) or (3), impose any condition that the relevant authority considers appropriate.

Subsection (1)(f) does not require a relevant authority to disclose, in or in relation to a civil proceeding, any information that the relevant authority may disclose, or has disclosed, under that subsection.
The Financial Secretary may authorize a public officer as a person to whom information may be disclosed under subsection (1)(g)(xiii).
A person who, knowing of a condition imposed under subsection (4), contravenes the condition, or aids, abets, counsels or procures any person to contravene it, commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Cap. 41 prescribed person (《第41章》訂明人士) means a prescribed person as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);
supervised group (受監管集團) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41).

section.name: s76E
section.heading: Person subject to inspection, investigation or disciplinary action must not disclose information

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person on whom a requirement under section 9 or 12 has been imposed by an authorized person or investigator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who has been given a notice under section 22, 44, 53ZA or 53ZSU.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(a) must not disclose any information obtained in the course of the requirement being imposed, or in the course of a compliance or purported compliance with the requirement, to any other person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant authority consents to the disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(b) must not disclose any information obtained from the notice, or from any communication with the relevant authority in relation to the subject matter of the notice, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant authority consents to the disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsections (2)(b) and (3)(b) are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser, who is acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure by the person specified in subsection (1)(a) or (b) is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, magistrate or tribunal, or in accordance with a law of Hong Kong or a requirement imposed under a law of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The relevant authority may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on a consent given by it for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) or (3)(a).
A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) has the meaning given by section 8;
investigator (調查員) has the meaning given by section 8.

section.name: s76F
section.heading: Recipient of information disclosed under section 76C, 76D or 76E must not disclose it onwards

subsection.leadIn: If information is disclosed under section 76C (except subsection (1)(b) or (2)(b)) or section 76D (except subsection (1)(a), (f) or (i)) or section 76E, each specified recipient must not disclose the information to another person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant authority consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser, who is acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, magistrate or tribunal, or in accordance with a law of Hong Kong or a requirement imposed under a law of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant authority referred to in subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of information disclosed under section 76C—

subparagraph.content: if paragraph (a) of the definition of specified person in section 76A applies—is the specified person;

if paragraph (b) of the definition of specified person in section 76A applies—is the relevant authority of whom the specified person is or was a member, an employee, or a consultant, agent or adviser; or

subparagraph.leadIn: is the relevant authority concerned with a provision of this Ordinance where (as the case requires)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the specified person is or was a person appointed under that provision of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: B
C

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of information disclosed under section 76D—is the relevant authority disclosing it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of information disclosed under section 76E—is the relevant authority—

subparagraph.content: by whom the person imposing the requirement referred to in section 76E(1)(a) is authorized under section 9(12) or directed or appointed under section 11; or
by whom the notice referred to in section 76E(1)(b) is given.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a specified recipient of information disclosed under section 76E if the condition in section 76E(4)(a) is satisfied.
The relevant authority may, in giving consent under subsection (1)(a), impose any condition that the relevant authority considers appropriate.
A person who, knowing of a condition imposed under subsection (5), contravenes the condition, or aids, abets, counsels or procures any person to contravene it, commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedRecipient
def.leadIn: specified recipient (指明收取人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom any information is disclosed (first recipient) under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person obtaining or receiving any information, directly or indirectly, from the first recipient.

section.name: s76G
section.heading: Other enactments on disclosure of information not affected

subsection.leadIn: Sections 76A, 76B, 76C, 76D, 76E and 76F do not prejudice the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 120 and 121 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 53A, 53B and 121 of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 50 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 378 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other provision in an Ordinance governing a financial regulator that relates to the sharing or disclosure of information by the financial regulator.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: financial regulator (金融監管者) means an authority or body that regulates, supervises or investigates banking, securities, insurance, activities involving virtual assets or other financial services.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Regulations by Chief Executive in Council

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance (except Parts 5, 5A, 5B and 5C). (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 23; 15 of 2022 s. 30)

Without limiting subsection (1), the regulations may include any savings, transitional, incidental, supplemental, evidential and consequential provisions (whether involving the provisions of any principal legislation or provisions of any subsidiary legislation).

section.name: s78
section.heading: Standard of proof
section.leadIn: If it is necessary for a relevant authority to establish or to be satisfied, for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance (other than provisions relating to criminal proceedings or to an offence), that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person has contravened—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any provision of any Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any notice or requirement given or imposed under any Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any of the conditions of any licence under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other condition imposed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person has been responsible for an unlawful act or omission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person has assisted, counselled, procured or induced any other person to do anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person has been concerned in, or a party to, anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person has attempted, or conspired with any other person, to commit anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any of the matters referred to in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) might occur,

section.continued: it is sufficient for the relevant authority to establish, or to be satisfied as to, the matter referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f), as the case requires, on the standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Prosecution of offences by relevant authorities

subsection.content: A relevant authority may prosecute an offence under this Ordinance, or an offence of conspiracy to commit such an offence, in its own name but if a relevant authority so prosecutes, the offence must be tried before a magistrate as an offence that is triable summarily.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of the prosecution of an offence mentioned in subsection (1), an employee or staff member of the relevant authority who is not qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appear and plead before a magistrate in any case of which the employee or member has charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, in relation to the prosecution, all the other rights of a person qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under that Ordinance.

subsection.content: This section does not derogate from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Giving of notices by relevant authorities

subsection.content: A notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given or sent by the Commissioner to a licensee under this Ordinance is to be regarded for all purposes as duly given or sent if it is left at, or sent by post to, the premises or any of the premises specified in the licensee’s licence as premises at which the licensee may operate a money service.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1B) applies to a notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given or sent under this Ordinance to a person (intended recipient)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the Commissioner in connection with Part 5C. (Replaced 15 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document referred to in subsection (1A) is given or sent to the intended recipient if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an individual, it is left at, or sent by post to, the individual’s last known—

subparagraph.content: business address;
residential address; or
correspondence address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a partnership, it is left at, or sent by post to, the partnership’s last known—

subparagraph.content: principal place of business; or
business address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a corporation that is a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), it is left at, or sent by post to, the corporation’s—

subparagraph.content: registered office (within the meaning of that Ordinance); or
last known business address;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for any other corporation, it is left at, or sent by post to, the corporation’s last known business address; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for an intended recipient referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d), it is sent by electronic means to the intended recipient’s last known electronic mail address. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.content: Section 127 of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to the giving or sending of a notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given or sent by the Insurance Authority to a person under this Ordinance as it applies in relation to the giving or serving of a notice or other document referred to in that section. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 161)

Section 134 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to the giving or sending of a notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given or sent by the Monetary Authority to a person under this Ordinance as it applies in relation to the serving of a notice referred to in that section.

Section 400 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to the giving or sending of a notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given or sent by the Securities and Futures Commission to a person under this Ordinance as it applies in relation to the issuing or serving of a notice, direction or other document referred to in that section.

Despite subsection (4), section 141 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to the giving or serving of a written notice or other document (however described) authorized or required to be given, or served (however described) to or on a licensed VAS person under this Ordinance as it applies in relation to the issuing or serving of a notice, decision or direction or other document referred to in that section. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: licensed VAS person (持牌虛擬資產服務人士) means a licensed provider or a licensed representative within the meaning of Part 5B. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 31)

section.name: s81
section.heading: Legal professional privilege

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Ordinance does not affect any claims, rights or entitlements that would, apart from this Ordinance, arise on the ground of legal professional privilege.

Subsection (1) does not affect any requirement made under this Ordinance to disclose the name and address of a client of a legal practitioner (whether or not the legal practitioner is qualified in Hong Kong to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor).

section.name: s82
section.heading: Transitional provision with regard to money changers and remittance agents carrying on business before commencement of this Ordinance

subsection.content: A person whose name was entered in the register maintained under section 24B(2) of the pre-amended Organized and Serious Crimes Ordinance as a money changer immediately before the commencement date is, on that date, deemed to have been granted a licence to operate a money service at all the premises entered in the register immediately before that date as premises at which the person carries on business as a money changer, and this Ordinance applies to the person accordingly.

A person whose name was entered in the register maintained under section 24B(2) of the pre-amended Organized and Serious Crimes Ordinance as a remittance agent immediately before the commencement date is, on that date, deemed to have been granted a licence to operate a money service at all the premises entered in the register immediately before that date as premises at which the person provides a service as a remittance agent, and this Ordinance applies to the person accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A licence deemed to have been granted under subsection (1) or (2) remains in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the expiry of the period of 60 days beginning on the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person has applied for a licence under section 30 before the expiry of that period, until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licence is granted;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner’s decision to refuse to grant a licence takes effect; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the application is withdrawn,

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: commencement date (生效日期) means the date of commencement of this Ordinance;
remittance agent (匯款代理人) has the meaning given by section 24A of the pre-amended Organized and Serious Crimes Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
section.def: currency (貨幣) includes a cheque and a traveller’s cheque;
designated retail payment system (指定零售支付系統) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71)
document (文件) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
function (職能) includes power and duty;
money (金錢) means money in whatever form or currency;

def.name: MoneyChangingService
def.leadIn: money changing service (貨幣兌換服務) means a service for the exchanging of currencies that is operated in Hong Kong as a business, but does not include such a service that is operated by a person who manages a hotel if the service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is operated within the premises of the hotel primarily for the convenience of guests of the hotel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consists solely of transactions for the purchase by that person of non-Hong Kong currencies in exchange for Hong Kong currency;

def.name: MoneyLaundering
def.leadIn: money laundering (洗錢) means an act intended to have the effect of making any property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is the proceeds obtained from the commission of an indictable offence under the laws of Hong Kong, or of any conduct which if it had occurred in Hong Kong would constitute an indictable offence under the laws of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, represents such proceeds,

def.continued: not to appear to be or so represent such proceeds;

def.name: MoneyService
def.leadIn: money service (金錢服務) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a money changing service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a remittance service;

def.name: Property
def.leadIn: property (財產) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: money, goods, choses in action and land, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obligations, easements and every description of estate, interest and profit, present or future, vested or contingent, arising out of or incident to property as defined in paragraph (a);

section.def: record (紀錄) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

def.name: RemittanceService
def.leadIn: remittance service (匯款服務) means a service of one or more of the following that is operated in Hong Kong as a business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sending, or arranging for the sending of, money to a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receiving, or arranging for the receipt of, money from a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: arranging for the receipt of money in a place outside Hong Kong;

section.def: Review Tribunal (覆核審裁處) means the Tribunal as defined by section 54;
stored value facility (儲值支付工具) has the meaning given by section 2A of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71)

def.name: TerroristFinancing
def.leadIn: terrorist financing (恐怖分子資金籌集) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the provision or collection, by any means, directly or indirectly, of any property— (Amended 20 of 2012 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the intention that the property be used; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: knowing that the property will be used,

paragraph.continued: in whole or in part, to commit one or more terrorist acts (whether or not the property is actually so used); (Amended 20 of 2012 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making available of any property or financial (or related) services, by any means, directly or indirectly, to or for the benefit of a person knowing that, or being reckless as to whether, the person is a terrorist or terrorist associate; or (Amended 20 of 2012 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the collection of property or solicitation of financial (or related) services, by any means, directly or indirectly, for the benefit of a person knowing that, or being reckless as to whether, the person is a terrorist or terrorist associate; (Added 20 of 2012 s. 12. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: TrustOrCompanyService
def.leadIn: trust or company service (信託或公司服務) means the provision, in Hong Kong, by a person, by way of business, of one or more of the following services to other persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forming corporations or other legal persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: acting, or arranging for another person to act—

subparagraph.content: as a director or a secretary of a corporation;
as a partner of a partnership; or
in a similar position in relation to other legal persons;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: providing a registered office, business address, correspondence or administrative address for a corporation, a partnership or any other legal person or legal arrangement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: acting, or arranging for another person to act—

subparagraph.content: as a trustee of an express trust or a similar legal arrangement; or
as a nominee shareholder for a person other than a corporation whose securities are listed on a recognized stock market; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.def: trust or company service business (信託或公司服務業務) means the business of providing a trust or company service. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.name: s2
section.def: In the definition of terrorist financing, terrorist (恐怖分子), terrorist act (恐怖主義行為) and terrorist associate (與恐怖分子有聯繫者) have the meaning given by section 2(1) of the United Nations (Anti-Terrorism Measures) Ordinance (Cap. 575).

section.name: s3
section.content: A person who only provides to financial institutions a message system or other support systems for transmitting funds is not, for the purposes of this Ordinance, to be regarded as a person operating a remittance service.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

def.name: AccountingProfessional
def.leadIn: accounting professional (會計專業人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant as defined by section 2(1) of the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50), or a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Replaced L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporate practice as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a CPA firm as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Replaced L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.def: AFRC (會財局) means the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)
authorized insurer (獲授權保險人) means an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 162)

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (營業日) means any day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or a black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

def.name: CategoryBPMSRegistrant
def.leadIn: Category B PMS registrant (貴金屬及寶石B類註冊人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Category B registrant within the meaning of Part 5C; or

paragraph.name: b

section.def: Commissioner (關長) means the Commissioner of Customs and Excise, any Deputy Commissioner of Customs and Excise, any Assistant Commissioner of Customs and Excise or a person to whom the Commissioner of Customs and Excise has delegated any of his or her functions under section 26;
