corporation (法團) means a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or other body corporate incorporated either in Hong Kong or elsewhere; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

def.name: Customer
def.leadIn: customer (客户)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes a client; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a Category B PMS registrant, includes a person who is a party to any transaction carried out by the registrant while the registrant carries on a precious metals and stones business, whether the person makes or receives any payment to or from the registrant; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

def.name: Director
def.leadIn: director (董事), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation that is a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)—means a director as defined by that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other corporation—means a person (by whatever name called) who occupies in the corporation a position similar to that of a director referred to in paragraph (a); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: DNFBP
def.leadIn: DNFBP (指定非金融業人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an accounting professional;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an estate agent;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a TCSP licensee; or (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 32)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a Category B PMS registrant; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: DNFBP is an acronym for persons in the category described as designated non-financial businesses and professions in the Financial Action Task Force’s Recommendations. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: EstateAgent
def.leadIn: estate agent (地產代理) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a licensed salesperson as defined by section 2(1) of the Estate Agents Ordinance (Cap. 511); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.def: Estate Agents Authority (地產代理監管局) means the body established by section 4 of the Estate Agents Ordinance (Cap. 511); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: FinancialInstitution
def.leadIn: financial institution (金融機構) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed individual insurance agent; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 162)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance agency; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 162)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 162)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a licensed money service operator; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 71)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Postmaster General; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 71; 15 of 2022 s. 32)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an SVF licensee; (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71. Amended 15 of 2022 s. 32; 17 of 2025 s. 176)
subject to section 20A, a licensed VAS provider; or (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32. Amended 17 of 2025 s. 176)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a stablecoin licensee; (Added 17 of 2025 s. 176)

section.def: HKICPA (香港會計師公會) means the body known as the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants incorporated by section 3 of the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)
licensed VAS provider (持牌虛擬資產服務提供者) means a licensed provider within the meaning of Part 5B; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)
Insurance Authority (保監局) means the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 162)
Law Society (律師會) means The Law Society of Hong Kong; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: LegalProfessional
def.leadIn: legal professional (法律專業人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a foreign lawyer as defined by section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.def: licensed individual insurance agent (持牌個人保險代理) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Added 12 of 2015 s. 162)
licensed insurance agency (持牌保險代理機構) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Added 12 of 2015 s. 162)
licensed insurance broker company (持牌保險經紀公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Added 12 of 2015 s. 162)
Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

def.name: PMSRegistrant
def.leadIn: PMS registrant (貴金屬及寶石註冊人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Category A registrant or a Category B registrant within the meaning of Part 5C; or

paragraph.name: b

section.def: recognized stock market (認可證券市場) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)
re-domiciled company (經遷冊公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 272)
re-domiciled entity (經遷冊實體) means a re-domiciled company that is deregistered as required by section 820E(3)(a) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 272)
registered non-Hong Kong company (註冊非香港公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 272)

def.name: Registrar
def.leadIn: Registrar (處長) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar of Companies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person to whom the Registrar of Companies has, under section 53C(1), delegated his or her functions; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.def: Registrar of Companies (公司註冊處處長) means the person appointed as the Registrar of Companies under section 21(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: RegulatoryBody
def.leadIn: regulatory body (監管機構), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an accounting professional—means—(Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.content: (subject to subparagraphs (ii) and (iii)) the AFRC;
(for the purposes of section 4) the AFRC or the HKICPA; or
(for the purposes of section 7(1), (2) and (3)) the HKICPA as overseen by the AFRC under section 9(b) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an estate agent—means the Estate Agents Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a legal professional—means the Law Society; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: RelevantAuthority
def.leadIn: relevant authority (有關當局)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an authorized institution, SVF licensee or stablecoin licensee, means the Monetary Authority; (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 71; 17 of 2025 s. 176)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed corporation, means the Securities and Futures Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an authorized insurer, licensed individual insurance agent, licensed insurance agency or licensed insurance broker company, means the Insurance Authority; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 162. Amended E.R. 4 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed money service operator or to the Postmaster General, means the Commissioner; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 25; 15 of 2022 s. 32)

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed VAS provider or an associated entity of a licensed VAS provider, means the Securities and Futures Commission; and (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

paragraph.name: g

def.name: Secretary
def.leadIn: secretary (秘書), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation that is a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)—means a company secretary as defined by that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other corporation—means a person (by whatever name called) who occupies in the corporation a position similar to that of a company secretary referred to in paragraph (a); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25)

section.def: Securities and Futures Commission, Commission (證監會) means the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 71; 15 of 2022 s. 32)
settlement institution (交收機構) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71)
stablecoin licence (穩定幣牌照) means a licence as defined by section 2(1) of the Stablecoins Ordinance (17 of 2025); (Added 17 of 2025 s. 176)
stablecoin licensee (穩定幣持牌人) means a licensee as defined by section 2(1) of the Stablecoins Ordinance (17 of 2025); (Added 17 of 2025 s. 176)
SVF licensee (工具持牌人) means a person who is granted a licence under section 8F of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71)
system operator (系統營運者) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Added 18 of 2015 s. 71. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 25)

def.name: TCSPLicensee
def.leadIn: TCSP licensee (信託或公司服務持牌人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who holds a licence granted under section 53G or renewed under section 53K; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deemed licensee as defined by section 53ZQ(5); (Added 4 of 2018 s. 25. Amended 15 of 2022 s. 32)

section.def: virtual asset (虛擬資產)—see section 53ZRA. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 32)

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Requirements Relating to Customer Due Diligence and Record-keeping

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—

def.name: BeneficialOwner
def.leadIn: beneficial owner (實益擁有人)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: means an individual who—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 25% of the voting rights at general meetings of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: exercises ultimate control over the management of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the corporation is acting on behalf of another person, means the other person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: means an individual who—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 25% of the voting rights in the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: exercises ultimate control over the management of the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the partnership is acting on behalf of another person, means the other person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a trust, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a beneficiary or a class of beneficiaries of the trust entitled to a vested interest in the trust property, whether the interest is in possession or in remainder or reversion and whether it is defeasible or not; (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the settlor of the trust;

subparagraph.name: 2a
subparagraph.content: the trustee of the trust; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a protector or enforcer of the trust; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: an individual who has ultimate control over the trust; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person not falling within paragraph (a), (b) or (c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: means an individual who ultimately owns or controls the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person is acting on behalf of another person, means the other person; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

def.name: BusinessRelationship
def.leadIn: business relationship (業務關係), as between a person and a financial institution or a DNFBP, means a business, professional or commercial relationship— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that has an element of duration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the financial institution or the DNFBP, at the time the person first contacts the financial institution or the DNFBP in the person’s capacity as a potential customer of the financial institution or the DNFBP, expects to have an element of duration; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.def: customer due diligence measures (客戶盡職審查措施) means the measures set out in section 2(1) of this Schedule;

def.name: EquivalentJurisdiction
def.leadIn: equivalent jurisdiction (對等司法管轄區) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a jurisdiction that is a member of the Financial Action Task Force, other than Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a jurisdiction that imposes requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule;

subsection.def: Financial Action Task Force (財務行動特別組織) means the Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering established by the G-7 Summit held in Paris in 1989; (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

def.name: FormerPoliticallyExposedPerson
def.leadIn: former politically exposed person (前政治人物) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a spouse, a partner, a child or a parent of an individual falling within paragraph (a), or a spouse or a partner of a child of such an individual; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a close associate of an individual falling within paragraph (a); (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

def.name: IdentificationDocument
def.leadIn: identification document (識別文件)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an individual, means his or her identity card, certificate of identity, document of identity or travel document, as defined by section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), means— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

subparagraph.content: the certificate of incorporation issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was formed and registered; or
the certificate of re-domiciliation issued in respect of the company under section 820C(5)(c) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company, means the certificate of registration issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was registered as a registered non-Hong Kong company; (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation that is incorporated in a place outside Hong Kong and that is neither a re-domiciled company nor a company falling within paragraph (c), means its certificate of incorporation or registration, or any other document evidencing its incorporation, issued by an authority in that place that performs functions similar to those of the Registrar of Companies; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to a partnership that carries on business in Hong Kong, means its business registration certificate issued under section 6 of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to a partnership that does not carry on business in Hong Kong, means its partnership agreement or any document evidencing its formation or registration issued by a governmental body;

subsection.def: legal person (法人) includes any public body and any body of persons, corporate or unincorporate;

occasional transaction (非經常交易) means a transaction between a financial institution or a DNFBP and a customer who does not have a business relationship with the financial institution or the DNFBP; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

def.name: PoliticallyExposedPerson
def.leadIn: politically exposed person (政治人物) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an individual who is or has been entrusted with a prominent public function in a place outside Hong Kong and— (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: includes a head of state, head of government, senior politician, senior government, judicial or military official, senior executive of a state-owned corporation and an important political party official; but

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a spouse, a partner, a child or a parent of an individual falling within paragraph (a), or a spouse or a partner of a child of such an individual; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a close associate of an individual falling within paragraph (a);

def.name: PreexistingCustomer
def.leadIn: pre-existing customer (先前客户)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a financial institution other than a licensed VAS provider—means a customer with whom the financial institution has established a business relationship before 1 April 2012;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in relation to a DNFBP other than a Category B PMS registrant—means a customer with whom the DNFBP has established a business relationship before 1 March 2018; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a Category B PMS registrant—means a customer with whom the registrant has established a business relationship before 1 April 2023; (Replaced 15 of 2022 s. 33)

def.name: PublicBody
def.leadIn: public body (公共機構) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any executive, legislative, municipal or urban council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any Government department or undertaking;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any local or public authority or undertaking;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: any board, commission, committee or other body that has power to act in a public capacity under or for the purposes of any enactment; (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 33)

def.name: RecognizedDigitalIdentificationSystem
def.leadIn: recognized digital identification system (認可數碼識別系統) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a financial institution or a DNFBP who is a TCSP licensee or a Category B PMS registrant, a digital identification system that is a reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a DNFBP who is an accounting professional, an estate agent or a legal professional, a digital identification system that is a reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant regulatory body; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.def: virtual asset transfer (虛擬資產轉賬)—see section 13A(1) of this Schedule. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of politically exposed person in subsection (1), a person is a partner of an individual if the person is considered by the law of the place where the person and the individual live together as equivalent to a spouse of the individual.

def.name: PoliticallyExposedPerson
def.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition of politically exposed person in subsection (1), a person is a close associate of an individual if the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual who has close business relations with the first-mentioned individual, including an individual who is a beneficial owner of a legal person or trust of which the first-mentioned individual is also a beneficial owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual who is the beneficial owner of a legal person or trust that is set up for the benefit of the first-mentioned individual.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a wire transfer is a transaction carried out by an institution (referred to in this Schedule as ordering institution) on behalf of a person by electronic means with a view to making an amount of money available to that person or another person (referred to in this Schedule as recipient) at an institution (referred to in this Schedule as beneficiary institution), which may be the ordering institution or another institution, whether or not one or more other institutions (referred to in this Schedule as intermediary institutions) participate in completion of the transfer of the money.

section.name: s2
section.heading: What are customer due diligence measures

subsection.leadIn: The following measures are customer due diligence measures applicable to a financial institution or a DNFBP— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a financial institution, or a DNFBP who is a TCSP licensee or a Category B PMS registrant, identifying the customer and verifying the customer’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information provided by— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a governmental body;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the relevant authority or any other relevant authority;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an authority in a place outside Hong Kong that performs functions similar to those of the relevant authority or any other relevant authority; (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: 3a
subparagraph.content: a recognized digital identification system; or (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant authority;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: for a DNFBP who is an accounting professional, an estate agent or a legal professional, identifying the customer and verifying the customer’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information provided by—

subparagraph.content: a governmental body;
the relevant regulatory body;

subparagraph.name: 3a
subparagraph.content: a recognized digital identification system; or (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)
any other reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant regulatory body; (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a beneficial owner in relation to the customer, identifying the beneficial owner and taking reasonable measures to verify the beneficial owner’s identity so that the financial institution or the DNFBP is satisfied that the financial institution or the DNFBP knows who the beneficial owner is, including, where the customer is a legal person or trust, measures to enable the financial institution or the DNFBP to understand the ownership and control structure of the legal person or trust;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a business relationship is to be established, obtaining information on the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship with the financial institution or the DNFBP, unless the purpose and intended nature are obvious; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if a person purports to act on behalf of the customer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for a financial institution, or a DNFBP who is a TCSP licensee or a Category B PMS registrant, identifying the person and taking reasonable measures to verify the person’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information provided by— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a governmental body;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the relevant authority or any other relevant authority;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an authority in a place outside Hong Kong that performs functions similar to those of the relevant authority or any other relevant authority; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any other reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant authority;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.leadIn: for a DNFBP who is an accounting professional, an estate agent or a legal professional, identifying the person and taking reasonable measures to verify the person’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information provided by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a governmental body;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the relevant regulatory body;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an authority in a place outside Hong Kong that performs functions similar to those of the relevant regulatory body; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any other reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant regulatory body; and (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: verifying the person’s authority to act on behalf of the customer. (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

section.name: s3
section.heading: When customer due diligence measures must be carried out

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4 of this Schedule, a financial institution or a DNFBP must carry out customer due diligence measures in relation to a customer in the following circumstances— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), before establishing a business relationship with the customer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before carrying out for the customer an occasional transaction involving an amount equal to or above $120,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency, whether the transaction is carried out in a single operation or in several operations that appear to the financial institution or the DNFBP to be linked;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: when the financial institution or the DNFBP doubts the veracity or adequacy of any information previously obtained for the purpose of identifying the customer or for the purpose of verifying the customer’s identity.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4 of this Schedule and despite subsection (1)(b), a financial institution must carry out customer due diligence measures in relation to a customer before carrying out for the customer an occasional transaction that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a wire transfer involving an amount equal to or above $8,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a virtual asset transfer involving virtual assets that amount to no less than $8,000,

subsection.continued: whether the transaction is carried out in a single operation or in several operations that appear to the financial institution to be linked. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4 of this Schedule and despite subsection (1)(b), a licensed VAS provider must carry out customer due diligence measures in relation to a customer before carrying out for the customer an occasional transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: involves an amount equal to or above $8,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a wire transfer or a virtual asset transfer,

subsection.continued: whether the transaction is carried out in a single operation or in several operations that appear to the licensed VAS provider to be linked. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1)(a), a financial institution or a DNFBP may verify the identity of a customer and any beneficial owner of the customer after establishing a business relationship with the customer if— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this is necessary not to interrupt the normal conduct of business with regard to the customer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any risk of money laundering or terrorist financing that may be caused by carrying out the verification after establishing the business relationship is effectively managed.

subsection.content: A financial institution or a DNFBP that carries out verification after establishing a business relationship with a customer under subsection (2) must complete the verification as soon as reasonably practicable after establishing the business relationship.

subsection.leadIn: If a financial institution or a DNFBP is unable to comply with subsection (1), (1A), (1B) or (3), the financial institution or the DNFBP— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not establish a business relationship or carry out any occasional transaction with that customer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the financial institution or the DNFBP has already established a business relationship with that customer, must terminate the business relationship as soon as reasonably practicable.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Simplified customer due diligence

subsection.content: In any of the circumstances set out in section 3(1)(a) and (b), (1A) and (1B) of this Schedule, a financial institution or a DNFBP may, instead of carrying out all the customer due diligence measures, carry out only the measures set out in section 2(1)(a), (ab), (c) and (d) of this Schedule in relation to a customer if the financial institution or the DNFBP has reasonable grounds to believe that the customer falls within subsection (3). (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

If a customer of a financial institution or a DNFBP not falling within subsection (3) has in the customer’s beneficial ownership chain an entity that falls within that subsection, the financial institution or the DNFBP is not required, when carrying out the measure set out in section 2(1)(b) of this Schedule in respect of the beneficial owners in that chain in any of the circumstances set out in section 3(1)(a) and (b), (1A) and (1B) of this Schedule, to identify, or verify the identities of, the beneficial owners of that entity or of any person in that chain beyond that entity. (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The customer is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an institution that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is incorporated or established in an equivalent jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carries on a business similar to that carried on by a financial institution;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: is supervised for compliance with those requirements by an authority in that jurisdiction that performs functions similar to those of any of the relevant authorities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a corporation listed on any stock exchange;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an investment vehicle where the person responsible for carrying out measures that are similar to the customer due diligence measures in relation to all the investors of the investment vehicle is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a financial institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an institution that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is incorporated or established in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: is supervised for compliance with those requirements; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an institution that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is incorporated or established in an equivalent jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: is supervised for compliance with those requirements;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Government or any public body in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the government of an equivalent jurisdiction or a body in an equivalent jurisdiction that performs functions similar to those of a public body.

subsection.content: In any of the circumstances set out in section 3(1)(a) and (b), (1A) and (1B) of this Schedule, a financial institution or a DNFBP may, instead of carrying out all the customer due diligence measures, carry out only the measures set out in section 2(1)(a), (ab), (c) and (d) of this Schedule in relation to a customer if the financial institution or the DNFBP has reasonable grounds to believe that the product related to the transaction falls within subsection (5). (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The product is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provident, pension, retirement or superannuation scheme (however described) that provides retirement benefits to employees, where contributions to the scheme are made by way of deduction from income from employment and the scheme rules do not permit the assignment of a member’s interest under the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an insurance policy for the purposes of a provident, pension, retirement or superannuation scheme (however described) that does not contain a surrender clause and cannot be used as a collateral; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a life insurance policy in respect of which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an annual premium of no more than $8,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency is payable; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a single premium of no more than $20,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency is payable.

subsection.leadIn: If a customer of a financial institution is a solicitor or a firm of solicitors, the financial institution is not required, in any of the circumstances set out in section 3(1)(a) and (b), (1A) and (1B) of this Schedule, to carry out the measure set out in section 2(1)(b) of this Schedule in relation to an account— (Amended 15 of 2022 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is kept in the name of the customer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in which moneys or securities of the customer’s clients are mingled; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is managed by the customer as those clients’ agent.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: securities (證券) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Duty to continuously monitor business relationships

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution or a DNFBP must continuously monitor the business relationship with a customer by— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reviewing from time to time documents, data and information relating to the customer that have been obtained by the financial institution or the DNFBP for the purpose of complying with the requirements imposed under this Part to ensure that they are up-to-date and relevant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conducting appropriate scrutiny of transactions carried out for the customer to ensure that they are consistent with the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s knowledge of the customer and the customer’s business and risk profile, and with the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s knowledge of the source of the customer’s funds; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: identifying transactions that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are complex, unusually large in amount or of an unusual pattern; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: have no apparent economic or lawful purpose,

paragraph.continued: and examining the background and purposes of those transactions and setting out the findings in writing.

subsection.content: When a financial institution or a DNFBP carries out the duty under subsection (1)(a) in relation to a pre-existing customer before the financial institution or the DNFBP first carries out the customer due diligence measures in relation to the customer in accordance with the requirements under this Part, the financial institution or the DNFBP is only required to review the documents, data and information relating to the customer that are held by the financial institution or the DNFBP at the time the financial institution or the DNFBP conducts the review.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a customer of a financial institution or a DNFBP has not been physically present for identification purposes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a customer, or a beneficial owner of a customer, of a financial institution or a DNFBP is known to the financial institution or the DNFBP, from publicly known information or information in the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s possession, to be a politically exposed person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a customer, or a beneficial owner of a customer, of a financial institution or a DNFBP is involved in a situation referred to in section 15 of this Schedule,

subsection.continued: the financial institution or the DNFBP must, in monitoring the business relationship with the customer under this section, take additional measures to compensate for any risk of money laundering or terrorist financing that may be caused by the fact that the customer or beneficial owner is a customer or beneficial owner falling within paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.content: Subsection (3)(a) does not apply in relation to a customer of a financial institution or a DNFBP if the financial institution or the DNFBP has carried out the measure referred to in section 2(1)(a) or (ab) of this Schedule in relation to the customer on the basis of data or information provided by a recognized digital identification system. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3)(b) does not apply in relation to a customer, or a beneficial owner of a customer, of a financial institution or a DNFBP if the financial institution or the DNFBP is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the customer or the beneficial owner of the customer is a former politically exposed person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former politically exposed person does not present a high risk of money laundering or terrorist financing based on an appropriate risk assessment. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Provisions relating to pre-existing customers

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a pre-existing customer who is not a customer to whom section 7 of this Schedule applies, a financial institution or a DNFBP must, in addition to the situations specified in section 3(1)(d) and (e) of this Schedule, carry out the customer due diligence measures when— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a transaction takes place with regard to the customer that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is, by virtue of the amount or nature of the transaction, unusual or suspicious; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not consistent with the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s knowledge of the customer or the customer’s business or risk profile, or with the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s knowledge of the source of the customer’s funds; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a material change occurs in the way in which the customer’s account is operated.

subsection.content: If a financial institution or a DNFBP is unable to comply with subsection (1), the financial institution or the DNFBP must terminate the business relationship with the customer as soon as reasonably practicable.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Provisions relating to pre-existing respondent banks

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a customer (referred to in this section as respondent bank) of an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is an institution located in a place outside Hong Kong carrying on a business similar to that carried on by an authorized institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with which the first-mentioned authorized institution has established a correspondent banking relationship before the date of commencement of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must terminate its correspondent banking relationship with a respondent bank on the date of commencement of this Ordinance unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it had carried out the measures set out in section 14(1) of this Schedule in relation to the respondent bank at some time before that date and was at that time satisfied that the anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing controls of the respondent bank were adequate and effective;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it had documented its responsibilities and the responsibilities of the respondent bank before that date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it was satisfied at some time before that date that, in respect of those of the respondent bank’s customers who could directly operate the accounts it maintained for the respondent bank, the respondent bank—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: had verified the identities of those customers, and would continuously monitor its business relationships with those customers, in accordance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was able to provide to it, on request, the documents, data or information obtained by the respondent bank in relation to those customers in accordance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Requirements in this Division are additional to those in sections 3 and 5 of this Schedule
section.content: In addition to complying with the requirements under sections 3 and 5 of this Schedule, a financial institution or a DNFBP must also comply with the requirements under this Division.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Special requirements when customer is not physically present for identification purposes

subsection.leadIn: If a customer has not been physically present for identification purposes, a financial institution or a DNFBP must carry out at least one of the following measures— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26; 15 of 2022 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: further verifying the customer’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information referred to in section 2(1)(a) or (ab) of this Schedule but not previously used for the purposes of verification of the customer’s identity under that section;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: ensuring that the payment or, if there is more than one payment, the first payment made in relation to the customer’s account is carried out through an account opened in the customer’s name with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an institution that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is incorporated or established in an equivalent jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: carries on a business similar to that carried on by an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: is supervised for compliance with those requirements by authorities in that jurisdiction that perform functions similar to those of the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a customer of a financial institution or a DNFBP if the financial institution or the DNFBP has carried out the measure referred to in section 2(1)(a) or (ab) of this Schedule in relation to the customer on the basis of data or information provided by a recognized digital identification system. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Special requirements when customer is politically exposed person

subsection.leadIn: If a financial institution or a DNFBP knows, from publicly known information or information in the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s possession, that a customer or a beneficial owner of a customer is a politically exposed person, the financial institution or the DNFBP must, before establishing a business relationship with the customer— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obtain approval from the senior management; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take reasonable measures to establish the customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of the funds that will be involved in the proposed business relationship.

subsection.leadIn: If a financial institution or a DNFBP comes to know, from publicly known information or information in the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s possession, that an existing customer or a beneficial owner of an existing customer is a politically exposed person or has become a politically exposed person, the financial institution or the DNFBP must not continue its business relationship with the customer unless the financial institution or the DNFBP— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has obtained approval from the senior management; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has taken reasonable measures to establish the customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of the funds that are involved in the business relationship.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in relation to a customer or a beneficial owner of a customer of a financial institution or a DNFBP if the financial institution or the DNFBP is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the customer or the beneficial owner of the customer is a former politically exposed person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former politically exposed person does not present a high risk of money laundering or terrorist financing based on an appropriate risk assessment. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Special requirements for insurance policies

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution must, whenever a beneficiary or a new beneficiary is identified or designated by the policy holder of an insurance policy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the beneficiary is identified by name, record the name of the beneficiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the beneficiary is designated by description or other means, obtain sufficient information about the beneficiary to satisfy itself that it will be able to establish the identity of the beneficiary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the time the beneficiary exercises a right vested in the beneficiary under the insurance policy; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the time of payout or, if there is more than one payout, the time of the first payout to the beneficiary in accordance with the terms of the insurance policy,

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution must carry out the measures specified in subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time a beneficiary exercises a right vested in the beneficiary under an insurance policy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of payout or, if there is more than one payout, the time of the first payout to a beneficiary in accordance with the terms of an insurance policy,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: The specified measures are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: verifying the beneficiary’s identity on the basis of documents, data or information provided by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a governmental body;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the relevant authority or any other relevant authority;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an authority in a place outside Hong Kong that performs functions similar to those of the relevant authority or any other relevant authority; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other reliable and independent source that is recognized by the relevant authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the beneficiary is a legal person or trust—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: identifying its beneficial owners; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is a high risk of money laundering or terrorist financing having regard to the particular circumstances of the beneficial owners, taking reasonable measures to verify the beneficial owners’ identities so that the financial institution knows who the beneficial owners are.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Special requirements for wire transfers

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to the following wire transfers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a wire transfer between two financial institutions if each of them acts on its own behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a wire transfer between a financial institution and a foreign institution if each of them acts on its own behalf;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a wire transfer if—

subparagraph.leadIn: it arises from a transaction that is carried out using a credit card, debit card or prepaid card such as—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: withdrawing money from a bank account through an automated teller machine with a debit card;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: obtaining a cash advance on a credit card; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: paying for goods or services with a credit card, debit card or prepaid card;
the card is not used as a payment system to effect a person-to-person transfer; and
the number (or equivalent unique identifier) of the credit card, debit card or prepaid card is included in the message or payment form accompanying the transfer. (Replaced 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3A), before carrying out a wire transfer, a financial institution that is an ordering institution must record— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the originator’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the originator’s account maintained with the financial institution and from which the money for the wire transfer is paid or, in the absence of such an account, a unique reference number assigned to the wire transfer by the financial institution; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the originator’s address, the originator’s customer identification number or identification document number or, if the originator is an individual, the originator’s date and place of birth; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the recipient’s name; and (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the number of the recipient’s account maintained with the beneficiary institution and to which the money for the wire transfer is paid or, in the absence of such an account, a unique reference number assigned to the wire transfer by the beneficiary institution. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subsection (3)(c) does not apply to a wire transfer involving an amount below $8,000 or an equivalent amount in another currency. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (6) and (7), a financial institution that is an ordering institution must include in the message or payment form accompanying the wire transfer— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a wire transfer involving an amount equal to or above $8,000 or an equivalent amount in another currency—the information recorded under subsection (3)(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) in relation to the transfer; and (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a wire transfer involving an amount below $8,000 or an equivalent amount in another currency—the information recorded under subsection (3)(a), (b), (d) and (e) in relation to the transfer. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.content: A financial institution may, in relation to a domestic wire transfer, include in the message or payment form accompanying the transfer only the information recorded under subsection (3)(b) in relation to the transfer but if it does so, it must, on the request of the financial institution to which it passes on the transfer instruction or the relevant authority, provide to that financial institution or the relevant authority the information recorded under subsection (3)(a) and (c) in relation to the transfer within 3 business days after it receives the request.

subsection.leadIn: If more than one individual wire transfer from a single originator is bundled in a batch file for transmission to a recipient or recipients in a place outside Hong Kong, a financial institution is not required to comply with subsection (5) in relation to each of the wire transfers if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the batch file contains the information recorded under subsection (3).

subsection.content: If a financial institution acts as an intermediary institution in a wire transfer, it must transmit all of the information that it receives with the transfer to the institution to which it passes on the transfer instruction.

subsection.leadIn: Where a financial institution is a beneficiary institution in a domestic wire transfer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the wire transfer is not accompanied by the information required under subsection (3)(b), it must as soon as reasonably practicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtain the information from the institution from which it receives the transfer instruction; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the information cannot be obtained, either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: consider restricting or terminating its business relationship with the institution referred to in subparagraph (i); or

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the financial institution is aware that the accompanying information that purports to be the information required under subsection (3)(b) is incomplete or meaningless, it must as soon as reasonably practicable take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved.

subsection.leadIn: Where a financial institution is a beneficiary institution or an intermediary institution in a wire transfer that is not a domestic wire transfer— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the wire transfer is not accompanied by all of the information required under subsection (3), it must as soon as reasonably practicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtain the missing information from the institution from which it receives the transfer instruction; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the missing information cannot be obtained, either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: consider restricting or terminating its business relationship with the institution referred to in subparagraph (i); or

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the financial institution is aware that any of the accompanying information that purports to be the information required under subsection (3) is incomplete or meaningless, it must as soon as reasonably practicable take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: domestic wire transfer (本地電傳轉賬) means a wire transfer in which the ordering institution and the beneficiary institution and, if one or more intermediary institutions are involved in the transfer, the intermediary institution or all the intermediary institutions are financial institutions located in Hong Kong;

def.name: ForeignInstitution
def.leadIn: foreign institution (外地機構) means an institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is located in a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that carries on a business similar to that carried on by a financial institution;

def.name: Originator
def.leadIn: originator (匯款人), in relation to a wire transfer, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person from whose account with the ordering institution the money for the wire transfer is paid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such an account, the person who instructs the ordering institution to carry out the wire transfer.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Special requirements for remittance transactions

subsection.content: This section applies to a remittance transaction, other than a wire transfer, involving an amount equal to or above $8,000 or an equivalent amount in any other currency, that is carried out by a licensed money service operator.

subsection.leadIn: Before carrying out a remittance transaction, a licensed money service operator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the originator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: verify the identity of the originator by reference to the originator’s identification document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: record—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the originator’s name;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the originator’s address;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the currency and amount involved; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the date and time of receipt of the instructions, the recipient’s name and address and the method of delivery.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Originator
def.leadIn: originator (匯款人), in relation to a remittance transaction carried out by a licensed money service operator, means—

paragraph.name: a
b

subsection.def: remittance transaction (匯款交易) means a transaction for sending, or arranging for the sending of, money to a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s13A
section.heading: Special requirements for virtual asset transfer

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a virtual asset transfer is a transaction carried out—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: with a view to making the virtual assets available—

subparagraph.content: to that person or another person (recipient); and
at an institution (beneficiary institution), which may be the ordering institution or another institution,

subsection.continued: whether or not one or more other institutions (intermediary institutions) participate in completion of the transfer of the virtual assets.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), before carrying out a virtual asset transfer, a financial institution that is an ordering institution must obtain and record—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the originator’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the originator’s account maintained with the financial institution and from which the virtual assets are transferred or, in the absence of such an account, a unique reference number assigned to the virtual asset transfer by the financial institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the originator’s address, the originator’s customer identification number or identification document number or, if the originator is an individual, the originator’s date and place of birth;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the recipient’s name; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the number of the recipient’s account maintained with the beneficiary institution and to which the virtual assets are transferred or, in the absence of such an account, a unique reference number assigned to the virtual asset transfer by the beneficiary institution.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) does not apply to a virtual asset transfer involving virtual assets that amount to less than $8,000.

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution that is an ordering institution in a virtual asset transfer must submit to the beneficiary institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a virtual asset transfer involving virtual assets that amount to not less than $8,000—the information obtained and held under subsection (2)(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) in relation to the transfer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a virtual asset transfer involving virtual assets that amount to less than $8,000—the information obtained and held under subsection (2)(a), (b), (d) and (e) in relation to the transfer,

subsection.continued: in accordance with codes and guidelines published under any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A financial institution that is a beneficiary institution in a virtual asset transfer must obtain and record the information under subsection (2) submitted to it by the institution from which it receives the transfer instruction.

If a financial institution acts as an intermediary institution in a virtual asset transfer, it must transmit all of the information that it receives with the transfer to the institution to which it passes on the transfer instruction.

subsection.leadIn: Where a financial institution (instructed institution) is a beneficiary institution or an intermediary institution in a virtual asset transfer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution (instructing institution) from which the instructed institution receives the transfer instruction does not submit all of the information under subsection (2) in connection with the virtual asset transferred to the instructed institution, the instructed institution must as soon as reasonably practicable—

subparagraph.content: obtain the missing information from the instructing institution; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the missing information cannot be obtained, either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: consider restricting or terminating its business relationship with the instructing institution; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the instructed institution is aware that any of the information submitted to it that purports to be information under subsection (2) is incomplete or meaningless, it must as soon as reasonably practicable take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Originator
def.leadIn: originator (匯款人), in relation to a virtual asset transfer, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person from whose account with the ordering institution the virtual assets for the virtual asset transfer are transferred; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such an account, the person who instructs the ordering institution to carry out the virtual asset transfer.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Special requirements for correspondent banking relationships

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must, before establishing a correspondent banking relationship with an institution located in a place outside Hong Kong that carries on a business similar to that carried on by an authorized institution (referred to in this section as proposed respondent bank)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: determine from publicly available information the reputation of the proposed respondent bank and the quality of its supervision by authorities in that place that perform functions similar to those of the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: assess the anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing controls of the proposed respondent bank.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not establish a correspondent banking relationship with a proposed respondent bank unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has obtained approval from its senior management;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: it has documented its responsibilities and the responsibilities of the proposed respondent bank; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that, in respect of those of the proposed respondent bank’s customers who will be able to directly operate the accounts it is to maintain for the proposed respondent bank, the proposed respondent bank—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: will verify the identities of those customers, and will continuously monitor its business relationships with those customers, in accordance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: will be able to provide to it, on request, the documents, data or information obtained by the proposed respondent bank in relation to those customers in accordance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Special requirements in other high risk situations
section.leadIn: A financial institution or a DNFBP must, in a situation specified by the relevant authority or, in the case of a DNFBP who is an accounting professional, an estate agent or a legal professional, by the relevant regulatory body, in a notice in writing given to the financial institution or the DNFBP and in any other situation that by its nature may present a high risk of money laundering or terrorist financing— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where a business relationship is to be established—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtain approval from the senior management to establish the business relationship; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: take reasonable measures to establish the relevant customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of the funds that will be involved in the business relationship; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where a business relationship has been established—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtain approval from the senior management to continue the business relationship;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is a beneficial owner in relation to the relevant customer, take reasonable measures to verify the beneficial owner’s identity so that the financial institution or the DNFBP is satisfied that the financial institution or the DNFBP knows who the beneficial owner is; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: take reasonable measures to establish the relevant customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of the funds that are involved in the business relationship; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where an occasional transaction is to be carried out, take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Anonymous accounts etc.
section.content: A financial institution or a DNFBP must not open, or maintain, any anonymous account or account in a fictitious name for any customer.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Correspondent banking relationships with shell banks

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not establish or continue a correspondent banking relationship with a corporation that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is incorporated in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is authorized to carry on banking business in that place;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: does not have a physical presence in that place; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: is not an affiliate of a corporation that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is incorporated in a particular jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is authorized to carry on banking business in that jurisdiction; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has a physical presence in that jurisdiction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c) and (d)(iii), a corporation has a physical presence in a place or jurisdiction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation carries on banking business at any premises in that place or jurisdiction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one full-time employee of the corporation performs banking-related duties at those premises.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), a corporation is an affiliate of another corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation is a subsidiary of the other corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one individual who is a controller of the corporation is at the same time a controller of the other corporation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: associate (相關者), in relation to a person entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, voting rights in relation to, or holding shares in, a corporation, means any other person in respect of whom that first-mentioned person has an agreement or arrangement, whether oral or in writing, express or implied, with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of shares or other interests in that corporation or under which they act together in exercising their voting rights in relation to it;

def.name: Controller
def.leadIn: controller (控制人), in relation to a corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of the corporation, or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary, are accustomed to act, but does not include any person in accordance with whose directions and instructions those directors are accustomed to act by reason only that they act on advice given by the person in his or her professional capacity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who, either alone or with any associate or associates, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting rights at any general meeting of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary;

subsection.def: subsidiary (附屬公司) has the same meaning as in the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Carrying out customer due diligence measures by means of intermediaries

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a financial institution or a DNFBP may carry out any customer due diligence measure by means of an intermediary specified in subsection (3) if— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intermediary consents in writing to be the financial institution’s or the DNFBP’s intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the financial institution or the DNFBP is satisfied that the intermediary will on request provide a copy of any document, or a record of any data or information, obtained by the intermediary in the course of carrying out the customer due diligence measure without delay.

subsection.content: A financial institution or a DNFBP that carries out a customer due diligence measure by means of an intermediary remains liable under this Ordinance for a failure to carry out that customer due diligence measure.

subsection.leadIn: The specified intermediary is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following persons who is able to satisfy the financial institution or the DNFBP that they have adequate procedures in place to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an accounting professional; (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an estate agent; (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a legal professional; (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a TCSP licensee; (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a financial institution that is an authorized institution, a licensed corporation, an authorized insurer, a licensed individual insurance agent, licensed insurance agency or licensed insurance broker company; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 163)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a lawyer, a notary public, an auditor, a professional accountant, a trust or company service provider or a tax advisor practising in an equivalent jurisdiction, or a trust company carrying on trust business in an equivalent jurisdiction, or a person who carries on in an equivalent jurisdiction a business similar to that carried on by an estate agent, or an institution that carries on in an equivalent jurisdiction a business similar to that carried on by an intermediary financial institution, that— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is required under the law of that jurisdiction to be registered or licensed or is regulated under the law of that jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to those imposed under this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is supervised for compliance with those requirements by an authority in that jurisdiction that performs functions similar to those of any of the relevant authorities or the regulatory bodies (as may be applicable); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a financial institution, an institution that—

subparagraph.content: is a related foreign financial institution in relation to the financial institution; and
satisfies the conditions in subsection (3A). (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the related foreign financial institution is required under group policy—

subparagraph.content: to have measures in place to ensure compliance with requirements similar to the requirements imposed under this Schedule; and
to implement programmes against money laundering and terrorist financing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the related foreign financial institution is supervised for compliance with the requirements mentioned in paragraph (a) at a group level—

subparagraph.content: by a relevant authority; or

by an authority in an equivalent jurisdiction that performs, in relation to the holding company or the head office of the financial institution, functions similar to those of a relevant authority under this Ordinance. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution or a DNFBP that carries out a customer due diligence measure by means of an intermediary must— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately after the intermediary has carried out that measure, obtain from the intermediary the data or information that the intermediary has obtained in the course of carrying out that measure, but nothing in this paragraph requires the financial institution or the DNFBP to obtain at the same time from the intermediary a copy of any document, or a record of any data or information, that is obtained by the intermediary in the course of carrying out that measure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the intermediary will, if requested by the financial institution or the DNFBP within the period referred to in section 20(2) or (3) of this Schedule, as the case requires, provide to the financial institution or the DNFBP a copy of any document, or a record of any data or information, obtained by the intermediary in the course of carrying out that measure as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a financial institution, if the intermediary is a specified intermediary under subsection (3)(d), take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing involved. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.content: Nothing in this section prevents a financial institution or a DNFBP from carrying out a customer due diligence measure by an agent but such a financial institution or a DNFBP remains liable under this Ordinance for a failure to carry out that customer due diligence measure.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: group of companies (公司集團) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);

def.name: GroupPolicy
def.leadIn: group policy (集團政策) means a policy of the group of companies to which the financial institution belongs that applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant related foreign financial institution;

subsection.def: holding company (控權公司), in relation to a financial institution, means a holding company within the meaning of section 13 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
intermediary financial institution (中介人金融機構) means a financial institution mentioned in subsection (3)(b);

def.name: RelatedForeignFinancialInstitution
def.leadIn: related foreign financial institution (相關外地金融機構), in relation to a financial institution, means another institution that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries on, in a place outside Hong Kong, a business similar to that carried on by an intermediary financial institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: falls within any of the following descriptions—

subparagraph.content: it is within the same group of companies as the financial institution;
if the financial institution is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled entity, it is a branch of the financial institution; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

subparagraph.leadIn: if the financial institution is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled entity— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: it is the head office of the financial institution; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: it is a branch of the head office of the financial institution. (Replaced 4 of 2018 s. 26)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Financial institutions and DNFBPs to establish procedures

subsection.content: A financial institution or a DNFBP must establish and maintain effective procedures for determining whether a customer or a beneficial owner of a customer is a politically exposed person.

A financial institution that carries out wire transfers must establish and maintain effective procedures for identifying and handling wire transfers in relation to which section 12(5) of this Schedule has not been complied with.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A financial institution that carries out virtual asset transfers must establish and maintain effective procedures for identifying and handling virtual asset transfers in relation to which section 13A(4) of this Schedule has not been complied with. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

A financial institution or a DNFBP must, in respect of each kind of customer, business relationship, product and transaction, establish and maintain effective procedures not inconsistent with this Ordinance for the purpose of carrying out the duties under sections 3, 4, 5, 9, 10 and 15 of this Schedule.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Duty to keep records
