subsection.leadIn: A financial institution or a DNFBP must— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to each transaction the financial institution or the DNFBP carries out, keep the original or a copy of the documents, and a record of the data and information, obtained in connection with the transaction in accordance with Part 2 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each customer, keep— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the original or a copy of the documents, and a record of the data and information, obtained in the course of identifying and verifying the identity of the customer or any beneficial owner of the customer in accordance with Part 2 of this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the original or a copy of the files relating to the customer’s account and business correspondence with the customer and any beneficial owner of the customer.

subsection.content: Records required to be kept under subsection (1)(a) must be kept for a period of at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the transaction is completed, regardless of whether the business relationship ends during that period.

Records required to be kept under subsection (1)(b) must be kept throughout the continuance of the business relationship with the customer and for a period of at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the business relationship ends.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Records required to be kept under subsection (1)(b) for an occasional transaction that is carried out in any of the circumstances set out in section 3(1)(b), (1A) and (1B) of this Schedule must be kept for a period of at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the occasional transaction is completed. (Added 15 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: A relevant authority or a regulatory body may, by notice in writing to a financial institution or a DNFBP, require the financial institution or the DNFBP to keep the records relating to a specified transaction or customer for a period specified by the relevant authority or the regulatory body that is longer than that referred to in subsection (2) or (3), as the case requires, if— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant authority or the regulatory body is satisfied that the records are relevant to an ongoing criminal or other investigation carried out by it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the records are relevant to any other purposes as specified by the relevant authority or the regulatory body in the notice.

subsection.content: A financial institution or a DNFBP to whom a notice is given under subsection (4) must keep the relevant records for the period specified in the notice.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Manner in which records are to be kept
section.leadIn: Records required to be kept under section 20 of this Schedule must be kept in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the record consists of a document, either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the original of the document must be kept; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the document must be kept either on microfilm or in the database of a computer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record consists of data or information, a record of the data or information must be kept either on microfilm or in the database of a computer.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Duties extended to branches and subsidiary undertakings outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: A financial institution that is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled entity must ensure that— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its branches; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its subsidiary undertakings that carry on the same business as a financial institution in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: have procedures in place to ensure compliance with, to the extent permitted by the law of that place, requirements similar to those imposed under Parts 2 and 3 of this Schedule that are applicable to the financial institution.

subsection.leadIn: If the law of the place at which a branch or subsidiary undertaking of a financial institution carries on business does not permit the application of any procedures relating to any of the requirements referred to in subsection (1), the financial institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the relevant authority accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take additional measures to effectively mitigate the risk of money laundering and terrorist financing faced by the branch or subsidiary undertaking as a result of its inability to comply with the requirement.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: A DNFBP that is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled entity must ensure that— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 273)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its branches; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its subsidiary undertakings that carry on the same business as a DNFBP in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: have procedures in place to ensure compliance with, to the extent permitted by the law of that place, requirements similar to those imposed under Parts 2 and 3 of this Schedule that are applicable to the DNFBP. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If the law of the place at which a branch or a subsidiary undertaking of a DNFBP carries on business does not permit the application of any procedures relating to any of the requirements referred to in subsection (2A), the DNFBP must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the relevant authority, or if applicable, the relevant regulatory body, accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take additional measures to effectively mitigate the risk of money laundering and terrorist financing faced by the branch or subsidiary undertaking as a result of its inability to comply with the requirement. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: branch (分行), in relation to a financial institution or a DNFBP, means a branch of the financial institution or the DNFBP outside Hong Kong at which it carries on a business similar to that carried on by the financial institution or the DNFBP, whether or not the business of the branch is limited by the laws or regulations of the place in which the branch is situated and whether or not the branch is referred to as an agency in that place; (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)
subsidiary undertaking (附屬企業) is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 1 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Financial institutions and DNFBPs to prevent contravention of Part 2 or 3 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: A financial institution or a DNFBP must take all reasonable measures— (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ensure that proper safeguards exist to prevent a contravention of any requirement under Part 2 or 3 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to mitigate money laundering and terrorist financing risks.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Operating a VA exchange, that is to say, providing services through means of electronic facilities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whereby—

subparagraph.content: persons are regularly introduced, or identified to other persons in order that they may negotiate or conclude, or with the reasonable expectation that they will negotiate or conclude sales or purchases of virtual assets in a way that forms or results in a binding transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where client money or client virtual assets comes into direct or indirect possession of the person providing such service.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Particulars to be notified on becoming an associated entity
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZRW(1), the particulars required to be provided to the Commission after an associated entity of a licensed provider becomes such an associated entity are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the licensed provider;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it became such an associated entity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its name and business name (if different);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date and place of its incorporation;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: its place of domicile, and the date beginning on which that place has been its place of domicile; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 274)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: each of its former places of domicile (if any), and the period during which that place was its place of domicile; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 274)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: its telephone and fax number, electronic mail address and website address (if any);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: each of the following addresses, together with its effective date—

subparagraph.content: the address of its principal place of business in Hong Kong (if any);
the address of its registered office;
its correspondence address;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the details of its bank account for holding client assets of the licensed provider received or held in Hong Kong, including—

subparagraph.content: the name of the bank with which the account is opened; and
the number of the account;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: whether it is aware of the existence of any matter that might render it insolvent or lead to the appointment of a liquidator;
the facts that gave rise to its becoming such an associated entity; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each of its executive officers who are its directors responsible for directly supervising the receiving or holding of the client assets of the licensed provider—

subparagraph.content: the executive officer’s name;
the executive officer’s Hong Kong identity card number, or details of documents issued by a competent government agency providing proof of identity; and
the executive officer’s contact details, including residential address in Hong Kong (if any) and correspondence address.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Particulars to be notified on ceasing to be an associated entity
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZRW(1), the particulars required to be provided to the Commission after an associated entity of a licensed provider ceases to be such an associated entity are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of ceasing to be such an associated entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the licensed provider;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether all client assets of the licensed provider received or held by it before it ceases to be such an associated entity have been fully accounted for and properly disposed of and, if not, the particulars of any such client assets that have not been fully accounted for and properly disposed of; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the facts that gave rise to its ceasing to be such an associated entity.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Annual return must include certain information

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZRY(4)(b), the information that a licensed person must include in the annual return is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reporting period of the licensed person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full description of any change in any prescribed information (if the description has not been provided to the Commission).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed information (訂明資料) means any information that has been provided to the Commission under Divisions 3, 4 or 7 of Part 5B or any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK;

def.name: ReportingPeriod
def.leadIn: reporting period (申報期) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 1 year to each anniversary of the date on which a person is licensed by the Commission as a licensed person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other period as may be approved by the Commission by written notice.

schedule.name: sch3F
schedule.heading: Auditable Entities—Prescribed Financial Statements and Other Prescribed Documents

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Financial statements etc. required to be submitted annually by licensed provider

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZSC(1)(a), the financial statements and other documents that a licensed provider must prepare, in respect of each financial year, are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a set of accounts consisting of each of the following, prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles—

subparagraph.content: a profit and loss account;
a balance sheet;
notes to the accounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as applicable, the following returns as required under any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK, each made up to the last day of the financial year—

subparagraph.content: a liquid capital computation;
a required liquid capital computation;
a summary of bank loans, advances, credit facilities and other financial accommodation available to it;
an analysis of its margin clients (if applicable);
an analysis of collateral received from margin clients (if applicable);
an analysis of its rolling balance cash clients;
an analysis of its client assets;
an analysis of its proprietary derivative positions (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a business and risk management questionnaire.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: margin client (保證金客户) means a client to whom the licensed provider provides virtual assets margin financing.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Financial statements etc. required to be submitted annually by associated entity
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZSC(1)(a), the financial statements and other documents that an associated entity of a licensed provider must prepare, in respect of each financial year, are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a set of accounts consisting of each of the following, prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles—

subparagraph.content: a profit and loss account;
a balance sheet;
notes to the accounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an analysis of client assets as at the end of the financial year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a business and risk management questionnaire.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Financial statements etc. required to be submitted by licensed provider on ceasing to provide VA service
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZSC(2)(a), the financial statements and other documents that a licenser provider must prepare if it ceases to provide the VA service for which it is licensed to provide are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a set of accounts as referred to in section 2(1)(a) of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a liquid capital computation as referred to in section 2(1)(b)(i) of this Schedule.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Financial statements etc. required to be submitted by associated entity on ceasing to such entity
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZSC(2)(a), the financial statements and other documents that an associated entity of a licensed provider must prepare if it ceases to be such an associated entity are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a set of accounts as referred to in section 3(a) of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an analysis of client assets as referred to in section 3(b) of this Schedule.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Requirements applicable to prescribed auditor’s report

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 53ZSC(1)(b) or (2)(b), a report of the prescribed auditor submitted by a licensed provider or an associated entity of a licensed provider to the Commission must contain a statement by the prescribed auditor as to whether, in the prescribed auditor’s opinion—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the profit and loss account and the balance sheet are in accordance with the records kept by the licensed provider or the associated entity under any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK and satisfy the requirements in the codes or guidelines;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: in the case of a licensed provider, each of the returns as referred to in section 2(1)(b) or 4(b) of this Schedule is correctly compiled from the records of the licensed provider or, if not correctly compiled, the nature and extent of the incorrectness;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, during the financial year in question, the licensed provider or the associated entity had in place systems of control, including internal controls and trading, custody, accounting and settlement systems, that were adequate to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements relating to client assets under any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, during the financial year in question, the licensed provider or the associated entity has complied with regulatory requirements relating to client assets and record keeping under any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in the case of a licensed provider, there appears to have been any contravention of regulatory requirements relating to financial resources under any codes or guidelines published under section 53ZTK by the licensed provider during the financial year in question.

subsection.content: A licensed provider or an associated entity of a licensed provider may submit 2 separate reports of the prescribed auditor in respect of a financial year, one containing a statement by the prescribed auditor concerning the matters referred to in subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c) and the other containing a statement by the prescribed auditor concerning the matters referred to in subsection (1)(d), (e), (f) and (g).

schedule.name: sch3G
schedule.heading: Transitional Arrangements for Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing (Amendment) Ordinance 2022

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5B, has the same meaning as in that Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: closing-down period (結業期)—see section 11 of this Schedule;
first 9 months (首9個月) means the period of 9 months beginning on 1 June 2023;
first 12 months (首12個月) means the period of 12 months beginning on 1 June 2023;

objection period (反對限期), in relation to a section 3 notice, section 5 notice or section 7 notice issued by the Commission in respect of a person, means a period specified by the Commission in the notice as the period within which the person may object to the deemed withdrawal of the person’s application or applications under section 10 of this Schedule;
section 3 notice (第3條通知)—see section 3(5) of this Schedule;
section 5 notice (第5條通知)—see section 5(5) of this Schedule;
section 7 notice (第7條通知)—see section 7(5) of this Schedule;
specified form (指明格式) means a form specified by the Commission;
VA service (虛擬資產服務) means operating a VA exchange within the meaning of item 1 of Schedule 3B.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Section 53ZRD not contravened by continuing pre-existing VA service during first 12 months

subsection.leadIn: An act by a corporation of carrying on, or holding itself out as carrying on, a business of providing a VA service does not constitute a contravention of section 53ZRD(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation has been carrying on the business of providing the VA service in Hong Kong immediately before 1 June 2023; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act is done during the first 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: An act by an individual of performing, or holding himself or herself out as performing, a regulated function in relation to a business, carried on by a corporation, of providing a VA service does not constitute a contravention of section 53ZRD(3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: because of subsection (1), an act by the corporation done, during the first 12 months, of carrying on the business of providing the VA service does not constitute a contravention of section 53ZRD(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act by the individual is done during the first 12 months.

subsection.content: In subsections (1) and (2), a reference to a corporation does not include one to which a closing-down period under section 11(1), (3) or (4) of this Schedule applies.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Persons Deemed to be Licensed or Approved After First 12 Months

section.name: s3
section.heading: Transitional arrangements apply to pre-existing provider on certain conditions

subsection.leadIn: Section 4 of this Schedule applies to a corporation if all of the following conditions are met in relation to the corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation has been providing a VA service in Hong Kong immediately before 1 June 2023;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within the first 9 months, the corporation—

subparagraph.content: gives the Commission a confirmation that the corporation has been providing the VA service in Hong Kong immediately before 1 June 2023; and

subparagraph.leadIn: gives the Commission a confirmation that the corporation will, on being deemed to be licensed to provide the VA service—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: comply with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed provider of the VA service; and

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Commission has not issued a section 3 notice under subsection (5) in respect of the corporation’s application.

subsection.content: The condition in subsection (1)(b)(i) is regarded as not met in relation to the corporation if the Commission has not acknowledged receipt in writing that it has received the application.

subsection.leadIn: If any of the matters specified in subsection (4) are not proved to the Commission’s satisfaction in relation to the corporation, the Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decide that section 4 of this Schedule is not to apply to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decide to commence the deemed withdrawal procedure under section 10 of this Schedule in respect of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all of the conditions specified in subsection (1)(a) and (b) are met in relation to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corporation has a reasonable prospect of successfully showing to the Commission that the corporation is capable of complying with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed provider of the VA service.

subsection.content: The Commission must inform the corporation of its decisions under subsection (3) by written notice (section 3 notice) given to the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: The section 3 notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the Commission’s decisions referred to in subsection (3) and the reasons for the decisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the corporation has a right under section 10 of this Schedule to object to the deemed withdrawal of the application within the objection period.

subsection.content: A section 3 notice may only be issued before the end of the first 12 months.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Corporate applicant deemed licensed provider pending determination of application

subsection.content: If, under section 3 of this Schedule, this section applies to a corporation that made an application referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) of that section, the corporation is deemed, for the period specified in subsection (2), to be licensed under section 53ZRK to provide the VA service to which the application relates.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins on the day immediately following the first 12 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ends on the day on which one of the following events happens (whichever happens first)—

subparagraph.content: the corporation’s application under section 53ZRK is withdrawn;
a licence is granted to the corporation under section 53ZRK.

subsection.leadIn: During the period the corporation is deemed under this section to be licensed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement in section 53ZRQ(1) does not apply in respect of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the premises in respect of which an application is lodged under section 53ZRR(2) are deemed to be approved; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the corporation is deemed to have complied with section 53ZRR(1) in relation to the premises.

subsection.leadIn: During the period the corporation is deemed under this section to be licensed and, if the corporation is granted a licence under section 53ZRK to provide the VA service, even after that, the day immediately following the first 12 months is to be regarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(1), as the date of the grant of the licence to the corporation, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(4), as the date on which the corporation is licensed, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transitional arrangements apply to representative of pre-existing provider on certain conditions

subsection.leadIn: Section 6 of this Schedule applies to an individual if all of the following conditions are met in relation to the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: within the first 9 months, the individual—

subparagraph.content: makes an application in accordance with section 53ZRL to be licensed to provide a VA service on behalf of a corporation (corporation), but not as a responsible officer on behalf of the corporation;
makes an application in accordance with section 53ZRM to be accredited to the corporation;

gives the Commission a confirmation that the individual is providing the VA service in Hong Kong on behalf of the corporation at the time the individual’s applications referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii) (individual’s applications) are made; and

gives the Commission a confirmation that the individual will, on being deemed to be so licensed comply with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed representative of a licensed provider of the VA service;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.content: the Commission has not issued a section 5 notice under subsection (5) in respect of the individual’s applications.

subsection.content: A condition in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii) is regarded as not met in relation to the individual if the Commission has not acknowledged receipt in writing that it has received the application referred to in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: If any of the matters specified in subsection (4) are not proved to the Commission’s satisfaction in relation to the individual, the Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decide that section 6 of this Schedule is not to apply to the individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decide to commence the deemed withdrawal procedure under section 10 of this Schedule in respect of the individual’s applications.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all of the conditions specified in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) and (d) are met in relation to the individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual has a reasonable prospect of successfully showing to the Commission that the individual is capable of complying with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed representative of a licensed provider of the VA service.

subsection.content: The Commission must inform the individual of its decisions under subsection (3) by written notice (section 5 notice) given to the individual.

subsection.leadIn: The section 5 notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the Commission’s decisions referred to in subsection (3) and the reasons for the decisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the individual has a right under section 10 of this Schedule to object to the deemed withdrawal of the individual’s applications within the objection period.

subsection.content: A section 5 notice may only be issued before the end of the first 12 months.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Individual applicant deemed licensed representative pending determination of application

subsection.leadIn: If, under section 5 of this Schedule, this section applies to an individual who made applications referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i) and (ii) of that section, the individual is deemed for the period specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be licensed as a licensed representative under section 53ZRL to provide the VA service on behalf of the corporation to which the applications relate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be accredited to the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins on the first day of the period for which the corporation is deemed under section 4 of this Schedule to be licensed to provide the VA service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ends on the day on which one of the following events happens (whichever happens first)—

subparagraph.content: the individual’s application under section 53ZRL is withdrawn;
the individual’s application under section 53ZRM is withdrawn;
the individual is granted a licence under section 53ZRL to provide the VA service on behalf of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: During the period the individual is deemed to be licensed under this section and, if the individual is granted a licence under section 53ZRL to perform a regulated function in relation to the provision of the VA service, even after that, the day immediately following the first 12 months is to be regarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(1), as the date of the grant of the individual’s licence, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(4), as the date of the grant of the individual’s licence, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transitional arrangements apply to individual applying to be responsible officer of pre-existing provider on certain conditions

subsection.leadIn: Section 8 of this Schedule applies to an individual if all of the following conditions are met in relation to the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: within the first 9 months, the individual—

subparagraph.content: makes an application in accordance with section 53ZRL to be licensed to provide a VA service on behalf of a corporation (subparagraph (i) corporation);
gives the Commission a confirmation that the individual has been providing the VA service in Hong Kong on behalf of a corporation that was providing the VA service immediately before 1 June 2023;

gives the Commission a confirmation that the individual is providing the VA service in Hong Kong on behalf of the subparagraph (i) corporation at the time the individual’s applications referred to in subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii) (individual’s applications) are made; and

gives the Commission a confirmation that the individual will, on being deemed to be so licensed, comply with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed representative and responsible officer of a licensed provider of the VA service;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.content: under section 3(1) of this Schedule, section 4 of this Schedule applies to the subparagraph (i) corporation; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Commission has not issued a section 7 notice under subsection (5) in respect of the individual’s applications.

subsection.content: A condition in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) or (iii) is regarded as not met in relation to the individual if the Commission has not acknowledged receipt in writing that it has received the application referred to in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: If any of the matters specified in subsection (4) are not proved to the Commission’s satisfaction in relation to the individual, the Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decide that section 8 of this Schedule is not to apply to the individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decide to commence the deemed withdrawal procedure under section 10 of this Schedule in respect of the individual’s applications.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the individual has a reasonable prospect of successfully showing to the Commission that the individual is capable of complying with the regulatory requirements applicable to a licensed representative and responsible officer of a licensed provider of the VA service.

subsection.content: The Commission must inform the individual of its decisions under subsection (3) by written notice (section 7 notice) given to the individual.

subsection.leadIn: The section 7 notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the Commission’s decisions referred to in subsection (3) and the reasons for the decisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the individual has a right under section 10 of this Schedule to object to the deemed withdrawal of the individual’s applications within the objection period.

subsection.content: A section 7 notice may only be issued before the end of the first 12 months.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Individual applicant deemed approved as responsible officer pending determination of applications

subsection.leadIn: If, under section 7 of this Schedule, this section applies to an individual who made applications referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) and (iii) of that section, the individual is deemed for the period specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to be accredited to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to be approved as a responsible officer of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins on the first day of the period for which the corporation is deemed under section 4 of this Schedule to be licensed to provide the VA service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ends on the day on which one of the following events happens (whichever happens first)—

subparagraph.content: the individual’s application under section 53ZRL is withdrawn;
the individual’s application under section 53ZRM is withdrawn;
the individual’s application under section 53ZRP to be approved as a responsible officer is withdrawn;
the individual is granted a licence under section 53ZRM to provide the VA service on behalf of the corporation and the individual is approved under section 53ZRP as a responsible officer;
the individual ceases, on or after the day immediately following the first 12 months, to act for or on behalf of the corporation in relation to the VA service.

subsection.leadIn: During the period the individual is deemed to be licensed under this section and, if the individual is granted a licence under section 53ZRL to perform a regulated function in relation to the provision of the VA service, even after that, the day immediately following the first 12 months is to be regarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(1), as the date of the grant of the individual’s licence, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 53ZRY(4), as the date of the grant of the individual’s licence, unless another date is approved by the Commission under that section.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to deemed persons

subsection.content: If a person is deemed for a period to be licensed to provide a VA service under section 4, 6 or 8 of this Schedule, this Ordinance applies to, and in relation to, that person as if the person were licensed, for that period, to provide the VA service under this Ordinance.
Subsection (1) has effect subject to sections 4(3) and (4), 6(3) and 8(3) of this Schedule.

If an individual is deemed for a period to be approved as a responsible officer under section 8 of this Schedule, this Ordinance applies to, and in relation to, that individual as if the individual were approved, for that period, as a responsible officer under this Ordinance.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Deemed withdrawal of applications

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person (applicant) has made an application or applications referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) (referred to in each case as specified application)—

subparagraph.content: an application made in accordance with section 53ZRK to be licensed to provide a VA service;

subparagraph.leadIn: both—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an application made in accordance with section 53ZRL for a licence to provide a VA service, but not as a responsible officer of a corporation providing the VA service; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an application made in accordance with section 53ZRM for accreditation to a corporation;

subparagraph.leadIn: all of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an application made in accordance with section 53ZRL for a licence to provide a VA service;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an application made in accordance with section 53ZRM for accreditation to a corporation;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an application referred to in section 53ZRP for approval as a responsible officer in relation to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission has given, to the applicant in respect of the applicant’s specified application, a specified notice, that is to say—

subparagraph.content: if paragraph (a)(i) applies, a section 3 notice;
if paragraph (a)(ii) applies, a section 5 notice; or
if paragraph (a)(iii) applies, a section 7 notice.

subsection.content: On receiving a specified notice, an applicant may object to the deemed withdrawal of the applicant’s specified application by giving to the Commission a written notice in the specified form within the objection period.

If the objection period in relation to the specified notice expires without the applicant having raised an objection in accordance with subsection (2), the applicant’s specified application is to be regarded as having been withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant objects to the deemed withdrawal within the objection period in accordance with subsection (2), the Commission must determine the specified application in accordance with (as the case requires)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 53ZRK;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 53ZRL and 53ZRM; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sections 53ZRL, 53ZRM and 53ZRP.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Closing Down if Corporation Not Deemed, or No Longer Deemed, to be Licensed

section.name: s11
section.heading: Duration of closing-down period

subsection.leadIn: If a corporation makes an application to be licensed for a VA service under section 53ZRK and a section 3 notice is issued in respect of the application, the closing-down period applicable to the corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins on the day on which the section 3 notice is issued (start day); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 14 of this Schedule, ends on the later of the following—

subparagraph.content: the expiry of the first 12 months;
the expiry of the 3 months beginning on the start day.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies whether or not the corporation has objected to the deemed withdrawal of the application in accordance with section 10 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation has made an application to be licensed for a VA service under section 53ZRK and is deemed under section 4 of this Schedule to be licensed for the VA service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corporation has withdrawn the application,

subsection.continued: the closing-down period applicable to the corporation is, subject to section 14 of this Schedule, the period of 3 months beginning on the day on which the application is withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation has made an application to be licensed for a VA service under section 53ZRK and is deemed under section 4 of this Schedule to be licensed for the VA service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the refusal of the application (decision), the corporation—

subparagraph.content: does not apply for a review of the decision; or
applies for a review of the decision but the decision is confirmed on review,

subsection.continued: the closing-down period applicable to the corporation is, subject to section 14 of this Schedule, the period of 3 months beginning on the day on which the decision takes effect as a specified decision under section 75.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Section 53ZRD not contravened by closing down business during closing-down period

subsection.leadIn: An act, by a corporation to which section 11 of this Schedule applies, of carrying on, or holding itself out as carrying on, a business of providing a VA service does not constitute a contravention of section 53ZRD(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act is done during the closing-down period applicable to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act is done solely for the purpose of closing down the business that is connected with the VA service.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies to an individual if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in connection with an application made by a corporation to be licensed to provide a VA service under section 53ZRK, the individual has made the following applications—

subparagraph.content: an application under section 53ZRL, to be licensed to provide the VA service on behalf of the corporation;
an application under section 53ZRM to be accredited to the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corporation is one to which a closing-down period under section 11(1), (3) or (4) of this Schedule applies (closing-down period corporation).

subsection.leadIn: An act, by an individual referred to in subsection (2), of performing, or holding himself or herself out as performing, a regulated function in relation to a business, carried on by the closing-down period corporation, of providing a VA service does not constitute a contravention of section 53ZRD(3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act is done during the closing-down period applicable to the closing-down period corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act is done solely for the purpose of closing down the business, of the closing-down period corporation, that is connected with that VA service.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Section 53ZRD not contravened by individual assisting to close down business in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an individual (specified individual) who does an act in relation to the carrying on, by a closing-down period corporation, of a business of providing a VA service does not contravene section 53ZRD(3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act is done during the closing-down period applicable to the closing-down period corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act is done solely for the purpose of closing down the business, of the closing-down period corporation, that is connected with the VA service.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no individual referred to in section 12(2) of this Schedule is able to assist the closing-down period corporation to close down that business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the closing-down period corporation has given prior written notice to the Commission that the specified individual would be assisting the corporation, and the corporation has received from the Commission a written acknowledgement of receipt of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: closing-down period corporation (結業期法團) means a corporation in respect of which section 11 of this Schedule specifies an applicable closing-down period.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Extension of closing-down period

subsection.content: A corporation, in respect of which section 11 of this Schedule specifies an applicable closing-down period, may apply to the Commission for an extension of that closing-down period.
An application under subsection (1) must be made, in writing, before the end of the closing-down period applicable to the corporation (if applicable, as extended under this section).

On receiving the application, the Commission may extend the closing-down period applicable to the corporation for a period that the Commission considers appropriate, having regard to the circumstances of the corporation’s business and activities.
For the purposes of sections 12 and 13 of this Schedule, the closing-down period applicable to the corporation must be taken to include the period as extended under this section.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Requirements imposed by Commission

subsection.content: The Commission may, by a written notice served on a corporation to which, or an individual to whom, section 12 or 13 applies, impose on the corporation or individual (recipient) one or more of the requirements specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements that the Commission may impose are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require the recipient to provide the VA service concerned in a specified manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require the recipient not to provide the VA service concerned in a specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require the recipient who is a corporation to deal with or refrain from dealing with, any assets whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere and whether or not they are the recipient’s assets, in a specified manner; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: to require the recipient who is a corporation to maintain assets in Hong Kong or a specified place outside Hong Kong so that—

subparagraph.content: the assets are of a value or class or description that appear to be desirable to the Commission for the purpose of ensuring that the recipient will be able to meet the recipient’s liabilities in respect of the business in the VA service concerned carried on by that recipient; and
the assets are maintained in a manner that will enable the recipient at any time to freely transfer or otherwise dispose of the assets.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsections (1) and (2), the Commission may impose any requirement under subsection (1) to apply during any period within the first 12 months if the period forms part of the closing-down period applicable to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation on which the requirements are imposed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the requirements are imposed on an individual acting in relation to the carrying on, by a corporation, of a business of providing a VA service—the corporation.

subsection.content: Any corporation or individual who fails to comply with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $10,000,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000.

subsection.leadIn: An individual who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Information to be provided
section.leadIn: A cash transaction report, in relation to a specified cash transaction (transaction) carried out by a non-Hong Kong precious metals and stones dealer (dealer) with a customer (customer), must contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: basic information of the dealer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: travel information of each specified individual (as defined by section 53ZVK(4)) in relation to the transaction—

subparagraph.content: last port before arrival in Hong Kong;
scheduled next port after departure from Hong Kong;
date of arrival in Hong Kong;
scheduled date of departure from Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: information on the transaction, including—

subparagraph.content: transaction date;
descriptions of the precious metals, precious stones, precious products or precious-asset-backed instruments traded;
amount of payment or payments in cash; and
address of the place where the transaction was carried out;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: basic information of the customer.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 5C, has the same meaning as in that Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—

def.name: BasicInformation

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an individual, means the following particulars of the individual—

subparagraph.content: full name;
number and place of issue of travel document;
nationality;
date and place of birth;
domicile or place of permanent residence;
address in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person who is not an individual, means the following particulars of the person—

subparagraph.content: name;
address of the principal place of business of the person;

subparagraph.leadIn: for a person that is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (B)—address of the registered office (or its equivalent) of the person in its place of incorporation; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the person has changed its place of domicile after its incorporation—address of the registered office (or its equivalent) of the person in its latest place of domicile; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 275)

subparagraph.leadIn: the following particulars of each individual acting on behalf of the person in the transaction—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: full name;

subparagraph.name: B
C
subparagraph.content: capacity in which the individual acted for the dealer;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: address in Hong Kong.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Provisions Relating to Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: panel member (委員) means a member of the panel of persons appointed under section 2(1) of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: application for review (覆核申請), parties (各方), review (覆核), Secretary (局長), specified authority (指明當局), specified decision (指明決定) and Tribunal (審裁處) have the same meaning as in Part 6.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Appointment of panel

subsection.content: The Secretary must appoint a panel of persons whom the Secretary considers suitable for appointment as ordinary members of the Tribunal and who are not public officers.
Subject to subsections (4) and (5), a panel member may be appointed for any term the Secretary considers appropriate.
A person whose term of appointment or reappointment as a panel member has expired may be reappointed.
A panel member may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Secretary.
The Secretary may by notice in writing remove a panel member from office on the grounds of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty, conflict of interest or misconduct.
To avoid doubt, section 55(3) does not require the appointment of persons to more than one panel under subsection (1).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Tenure of chairperson

subsection.content: The term of appointment of a person as chairperson must not exceed 3 years.
A person whose term of appointment or reappointment as chairperson has expired may be reappointed.
The chairperson may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date the Secretary receives the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may by notice in writing remove the chairperson from office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson is no longer qualified for appointment as chairperson under section 56(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the grounds of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty, conflict of interest or misconduct.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Appointment of ordinary members

subsection.content: For the purpose of determining a review, the Secretary, on the recommendation of the chairperson, must appoint 2 panel members as ordinary members of the Tribunal in relation to the review.

Subject to subsections (3) and (5), a panel member who is appointed as an ordinary member is appointed to act in relation to a specified review and may be reappointed after his or her term of appointment or reappointment as an ordinary member has expired.
An ordinary member may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date the Secretary receives the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.content: If an ordinary member ceases to be a panel member, he or she ceases to be an ordinary member.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Further provisions relating to chairperson and ordinary members

subsection.content: If the term of appointment of the chairperson expires after proceedings for a review have begun but before the review is determined, the person may continue to act as chairperson for the purpose of the review until the review has been determined.
Where there is a change in the membership of the Tribunal during the proceedings for a review, the proceedings may continue despite that change if the parties to the review so consent.
If the parties do not consent, the proceedings must be discontinued but they may begin anew.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Procedure

subsection.content: The chairperson must convene sittings of the Tribunal as often as necessary to enable the Tribunal to determine a review.

subsection.leadIn: At any time after an application for review has been received, the chairperson may give directions to the parties to the review concerning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: procedural matters to be complied with by any of the parties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which those procedural matters are to be complied with.

subsection.content: At any sitting of the Tribunal, the chairperson and 2 ordinary members must be present.
The chairperson is to preside at every sitting of the Tribunal.

Every question before the Tribunal is to be determined by a majority of the votes cast by the chairperson and the ordinary members, except that a question of law is to be determined by the chairperson alone.
Subject to subsections (7) and (8), every sitting of the Tribunal must be held in public.

If the Tribunal, on its own initiative or on the application of any of the parties to the review, determines that in the interests of justice a sitting or any part of a sitting should not be held in public, the Tribunal may hold the sitting or that part of the sitting in private.
If an application is made under subsection (7) for a private sitting, any hearing of the application must be held in private.

subsection.leadIn: At any sitting of the Tribunal relating to a review, the parties to the review are entitled to be heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in person, or—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a corporation, through an officer or employee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a partnership, through a partner; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a specified authority, through a representative; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through a solicitor or counsel or, with the leave of the Tribunal, through any other person.

subsection.content: The chairperson must prepare a record of the proceedings of every sitting of the Tribunal containing any particulars relating to the proceedings that the chairperson considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Representative
def.leadIn: representative (代表)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the Monetary Authority, means a person appointed by the Financial Secretary under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Insurance Authority, means an employee of the Authority; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 164. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 28)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to the Commissioner, means a public officer employed in the Customs and Excise Department; and (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 28)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to the Registrar, means a public officer employed in the Companies Registry. (Added 4 of 2018 s. 28)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Preliminary conferences

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), at any time after an application for review has been received, the chairperson may, on his or her own initiative or on the application of any party to the review, direct that a conference, to be attended by the parties or their representatives, is to be held for the purposes of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enabling the parties to prepare for the conduct of the review;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: generally securing the just, expeditious and economical conduct of the review.

subsection.content: The chairperson may only give a direction under subsection (1) if the parties to the review agree to the giving of the direction.
The chairperson may consider any material that has been submitted to the Tribunal in relation to the application by the parties to the review before giving a direction under subsection (1).
The chairperson is to preside at a conference held in accordance with a direction given under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: At a conference held in accordance with a direction given under subsection (1), the chairperson may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give any direction that he or she considers necessary or desirable for securing the just, expeditious and economical conduct of the review; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: try to get the parties to the review to make all agreements as they ought reasonably to have made in relation to the review.

subsection.content: After a conference has been held in accordance with a direction given under subsection (1), the chairperson must report to the Tribunal on any matters relating to the conference that the chairperson considers appropriate.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Consent orders

subsection.leadIn: At any time after an application for review has been received, the Tribunal or the chairperson may make any order that the Tribunal or the chairperson is entitled to make under any provision of this Ordinance, whether or not any other requirements applicable to the making of the order have been complied with, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the parties to the review request, and agree to, the making of the order under this section by the Tribunal or the chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties consent to all of the terms of the order.

subsection.content: Despite anything in this Schedule or in Part 6, if the Tribunal or the chairperson makes an order under subsection (1), the order is to be regarded for all purposes as an order made by the Tribunal or the chairperson under the provision of this Ordinance in question and to be in compliance with the requirements otherwise applicable to the making of the order.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: order (命令) includes any finding, determination and any other decision.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Chairperson as sole member of Tribunal

subsection.content: If, at any time after an application for review has been made but before any sitting of the Tribunal is held to determine the review, the parties to the review by notice in writing inform the Tribunal that they have agreed that the review may be determined by the chairperson alone as the sole member of the Tribunal, the chairperson may determine the review as the sole member of the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson may also determine an application as the sole member of the Tribunal if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made to the Tribunal under section 59(2) for the grant of an extension of the time within which an application for review may be made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application made to the Tribunal under section 69(2) for a stay of execution of a specified decision.

subsection.content: If the chairperson determines a review as the sole member of the Tribunal under subsection (1) or (2), the Tribunal constituted by the chairperson as the sole member of the Tribunal is to be regarded for all purposes as the Tribunal constituted also by 2 ordinary members.

subsection.leadIn: After the chairperson has made any determination under subsection (2)(b) as the sole member of the Tribunal, the chairperson must report to the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of the determination and the reasons for the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other matters relating to the determination that the chairperson considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If there is an application described in subsection (2)(b) and the chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from performing the chairperson’s functions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considers it improper or undesirable that he or she should perform his or her functions in relation to the application,

subsection.continued: a judge or a deputy judge of the Court of First Instance must, on appointment by the Chief Justice for the purpose, determine the application as if he or she were the chairperson duly appointed under this Ordinance, and the provisions of this Ordinance are to apply to him or her accordingly.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Privileges and immunities
section.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal, its chairperson and ordinary members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties to a review and any witness, solicitor, counsel or other person involved in a review,

section.continued: have the same privileges and immunities in respect of the review as they would have if the review were civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.
